4199463044,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-mainstreaming-4199463044?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=SUobieafVaph2BBC8iG06A%3D%3D&trackingId=YcuqfdAjt9rmCenRIWD4qQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,MainStreaming,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","MainStreaming® is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment

We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.
Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.

Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2: Master's degree preferred.

column1: 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.
Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.
Execution & Precision: Strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and accuracy in financial reporting.
Ownership & Accountability: Taking responsibility for work, following through on commitments, and delivering high-quality results.
Adaptability & Resilience: Thriving in a fast-paced environment, responding well to change, and maintaining professionalism under pressure.
Collaboration & Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.
A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills

In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Data Analyst


Job Description:


We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
  • Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
  • Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
  • Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.
  • Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
  • Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field

4201261100,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/associate-consultant-september-2025-at-analysys-mason-4201261100?position=44&pageNum=0&refId=SUobieafVaph2BBC8iG06A%3D%3D&trackingId=blfTipxUS%2BLUE5ah49QXGw%3D%3D,"Associate Consultant, September 2025",Analysys Mason,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who are we?
We are Analysys Mason – an award winning global management consulting firm helping clients to make and act on the decisions that steer their progress and connect our world.

Specialising in technology, telecoms, media and space sectors, we provide bespoke transformation, value creation, transaction, strategy and regulation and policy consulting, combined with research and insights. We help clients navigate complex transformation journeys, always shaping the next.
Since 1985, our team has expanded to 400+ professionals across 16 offices in 12 countries and our experts have taken on work in over 140 countries, making us a truly global company.

Our vision is to be the leading authority and catalyst for digital change, connectivity and inclusion. We are committed to a sustainable, connected future – contributing to a world where technology delivers for all.
Our graduate opportunities have a strong record of establishing early career foundations and developing well-rounded industry skills in our associate consultants.
You will work on a diverse mix of international projects with the best-known brands in the industry, applying our deep domain expertise and methodology to solve complex business issues.
You will attend our three-week comprehensive training programme where you will learn essential consulting skills and industry knowledge through courses, networking and teamwork.

After completing the training, you will join project teams and provide strategic advice and high-quality analysis on all aspects of strategy planning, transaction support, regulation and transformation while continuing your professional development.

Because our project teams are small, you will regularly get direct exposure to our world-class TMT experts, not only in your office, but also across our global locations. You will receive hands-on mentoring from experienced members of the team, including our Partners.
Our culture is collaborative and team-oriented, and you will have an impact on project delivery from an early stage, which will provide a steep learning curve and a structured career progression.
offering quantitative and qualitative analysis of that research
modelling and forecasting using various pieces of software
presenting your main findings in written, graphical and live form
contributing to proposal creation and client meetings
collaborating with other teams across our global locations
If you are a problem-solver who is critical and analytical in your approach, then this is the right job for you.
You must have graduated by September 2025, or earlier, and you must have a degree from any academic background (including STEM, Humanities and others).
You must enjoy working with numbers as we are a quantitative data-driven business.
As long as you are keen to learn about the sector, you do not need to have a TMT background. As a matter of fact, many of our consultants only became TMT experts after joining us.
You must be fluent in English and Italian.
On top of an exciting opportunity, we offer many attractive benefits, including:
continuous training for professional and personal development

Excellence | We are passionate and aspire to be the industry benchmark.
Partnership | We are one team, and we inspire, motivate and coach each other.
Innovation | We are problem-solvers, and we do not share away from a challenge.
Integrity | We treat people with dignity and respect.
Empowerment | We motivate, inspire and train our people to be the best they can be.

Who are we?

We are Analysys Mason – an award winning global management consulting firm helping clients to make and act on the decisions that steer their progress and connect our world.

Specialising in technology, telecoms, media and space sectors, we provide bespoke transformation, value creation, transaction, strategy and regulation and policy consulting, combined with research and insights. We help clients navigate complex transformation journeys, always shaping the next.

Since 1985, our team has expanded to 400+ professionals across 16 offices in 12 countries and our experts have taken on work in over 140 countries, making us a truly global company.

Our vision is to be the leading authority and catalyst for digital change, connectivity and inclusion. We are committed to a sustainable, connected future – contributing to a world where technology delivers for all.



Job Description

Our graduate opportunities have a strong record of establishing early career foundations and developing well-rounded industry skills in our associate consultants.

You will work on a diverse mix of international projects with the best-known brands in the industry, applying our deep domain expertise and methodology to solve complex business issues.

You will attend our three-week comprehensive training programme where you will learn essential consulting skills and industry knowledge through courses, networking and teamwork.

After completing the training, you will join project teams and provide strategic advice and high-quality analysis on all aspects of strategy planning, transaction support, regulation and transformation while continuing your professional development.

Because our project teams are small, you will regularly get direct exposure to our world-class TMT experts, not only in your office, but also across our global locations. You will receive hands-on mentoring from experienced members of the team, including our Partners.

Our culture is collaborative and team-oriented, and you will have an impact on project delivery from an early stage, which will provide a steep learning curve and a structured career progression.

Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:

  • conducting high-quality research
  • offering quantitative and qualitative analysis of that research
  • gathering and interpreting numerical data
  • modelling and forecasting using various pieces of software
  • presenting your main findings in written, graphical and live form
  • contributing to proposal creation and client meetings
  • collaborating with other teams across our global locations
  • developing deep sector knowledge
  • and more.

Qualifications

If you are a problem-solver who is critical and analytical in your approach, then this is the right job for you.

You must have graduated by September 2025, or earlier, and you must have a degree from any academic background (including STEM, Humanities and others).

You must enjoy working with numbers as we are a quantitative data-driven business.

As long as you are keen to learn about the sector, you do not need to have a TMT background. As a matter of fact, many of our consultants only became TMT experts after joining us.

You must be fluent in English and Italian.



Additional Information

On top of an exciting opportunity, we offer many attractive benefits, including:

  • an annual bonus
  • private health and dental care
  • flexible working
  • your birthday off
  • 2 promotion cycles a year
  • stepped career progression
  • continuous training for professional and personal development
  • career coaching programmes
  • volunteering days.

We are proud to be an equal-opportunities employer and ensure fair work practices for all our employees, clients, candidates and other associated persons.



Our values

Excellence | We are passionate and aspire to be the industry benchmark.

Partnership | We are one team, and we inspire, motivate and coach each other.

Innovation | We are problem-solvers, and we do not share away from a challenge.

Integrity | We treat people with dignity and respect.

Empowerment | We motivate, inspire and train our people to be the best they can be.

You will join the team of BI Product and in particular in the business / management Analytics&Insights reporting directly to Analytics&Insights Manager.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in understanding business needs, finding the most suitable analyses and suggesting actionable solutions.
Proven experience in main statistical modelling and machine learning techniques
A degree in (or PhD) in Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or related quantitative field
Excellent knowledge of Python, R, SQL, tools to manipulate large dataset
Ability to create an analysis starting from data preparation to insights definition and sharing with technical and no-technical audience .
Fluency in english is required, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
The option to join our company share saving scheme.
An inclusive work environment and participate in all our initiatives focused on Diversity & Inclusion
Well-Being Support: online meditation courses, medical online service and counselling with the help of certified psychologists and coaches

Learning and Development: access a platform full of training courses, join workshops, conferences. Exploit our FlexiLearning program, which allows you to dedicate at least 4 working hours per month for your professional growth
Parental Leave Packages: additional support for you, children and financial aid for mothers
Have a look at our amazing blog Inside: hear directly from our employees at the following link: Inside .
Reviews and comments from our Glassdoor and Indeed pages. Put yours!

4208839746,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-data-analyst-at-allianz-direct-4208839746?position=49&pageNum=0&refId=SUobieafVaph2BBC8iG06A%3D%3D&trackingId=WuEpqiWIYnj9QE0gkO7LrA%3D%3D,BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE DATA ANALYST,Allianz Direct,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","The successful candidate will join the Business Intelligence team in the data analyst role with the following responsibilities:
Requirements collection from business users and analysis of necessary information to be integrated into the DWH
Evolution of DWH data model in accordance with Group guidelines
ETL procedure management and development with azure data factory tool
Monitoring of data quality for appropriate use in business reporting
Setting and monitoring business KPIs to improve business performance
Develop reports and dashboards with Business Intelligence tools
Support users to perform analysis on DWH data and functional support for data navigation
Proven experience (e.g. 2-3 years) as a Data Analyst or Data Engineer
Strong Experience with cloud based infrastructures, Microsoft Azure platform will be preferred.
Knowledge of scripting languages, such as Python, R.
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL language and MS SQL Server)
Experience in design, implementation, maintenance of ETL pipelines in cloud environments to collect data from different sources
Strong knowledge of and experience of Azure Data Factory
Knowledge and experience of messaging system (Kafka)
Experience in data manipulation and Business Intelligence tools , Power BI will be preferred
Knowledge and experience of Azure Databricks
Work Experience in the insurance industry will be preferred

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.
Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.
Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).

The successful candidate will join the Business Intelligence team in the data analyst role with the following responsibilities:

  • Requirements collection from business users and analysis of necessary information to be integrated into the DWH
  • Evolution of DWH data model in accordance with Group guidelines
  • ETL procedure management and development with azure data factory tool
  • Monitoring of data quality for appropriate use in business reporting
  • Setting and monitoring business KPIs to improve business performance
  • Develop reports and dashboards with Business Intelligence tools
  • Support users to perform analysis on DWH data and functional support for data navigation

Key Requirements/Skills/Experience

  • Proven experience (e.g. 2-3 years) as a Data Analyst or Data Engineer
  • University degree in scientific-technological studies
  • Strong Experience with cloud based infrastructures, Microsoft Azure platform will be preferred.
  • Knowledge of scripting languages, such as Python, R.
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL language and MS SQL Server)
  • Experience in design, implementation, maintenance of ETL pipelines in cloud environments to collect data from different sources
  • Strong knowledge of and experience of Azure Data Factory
  • Knowledge and experience of messaging system (Kafka)
  • Experience in data manipulation and Business Intelligence tools , Power BI will be preferred
  • Knowledge and experience of Azure Databricks
  • Communication and Interpersonal Skills
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Accuracy and attention to detail
  • Fluent in Italian and English
  • Work Experience in the insurance industry will be preferred

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.

Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).

4196509421,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/finance-data-analyst-apprendistato-at-siemens-healthineers-4196509421?position=54&pageNum=0&refId=SUobieafVaph2BBC8iG06A%3D%3D&trackingId=o6tR4kgndy3zHzaAcJhY%2Fg%3D%3D,Finance Data Analyst - Apprendistato,Siemens Healthineers,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

Apply now for the position of Finance Analyst for the Southern Europe Business Performance Controlling Department in our Headquarter in Milan and you will carry out FP&A activities for the country and take part in the harmonization processes taking place on the 4 countries of the zone.
Data Collection and Analysis: gathering and analyzing financial data to support planning and decision-making.
Budget Preparation Support: assisting in the preparation of annual budgets and financial forecasts.
Performance Monitoring: tracking financial performance against budgets and forecasts, identifying variances.
Strategic Decision Support: providing analytical support for strategic decisions, such as investment evaluations.
Cross-functional Collaboration: working closely with other departments to ensure financial decisions align with overall business goals.
Master’s degree in economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Math or Engineering.
Good understanding of Office suite and Business Intelligence tools.
Interpersonal skills, result oriented, proactivity, autonomy, relational skills, team working.
Good knowledge of English and Italian language (spoken, written).
Knowledge of programming languages (i.e. SQL, Python, R, etc.)
Experience in applied Machine Learning and Predictive Analytics.
Deep knowledge of business intelligence tools.
To find out more about the specific business, have a look at www.siemens-healthineers.com.

We are a team of more than 71,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. As a leader in medical technology, we constantly push the boundaries to create better outcomes and experiences for patients, no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

When you join Siemens Healthineers, you become one in a global team of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists, who believe in each individual’s potential to contribute with diverse ideas. We are from different backgrounds, cultures, religions, political and/or sexual orientations, and work together, to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enable access to care, united by one purpose: to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably. Check our Careers Site at https://jobs.siemens-healthineers.com/careers.
As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from individuals with disabilities.

We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. Please create a profile within our talent community and subscribe to personalized job alert that will keep you posted about new opportunities.

Siemens Healthineers' recruitment is internally managed, with external support permitted only when a qualified supplier has established a formal contract with us. Unsolicited candidate submissions and referrals, absent a current supplier contract, do not establish consent and are ineligible for fees. We delete and destroy unsolicited information, thus, would recommend you refrain from any such practices. Your adherence to our policies is appreciated.

4184448402,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-platform-analyst-intern-at-italiaonline-4184448402?position=57&pageNum=0&refId=SUobieafVaph2BBC8iG06A%3D%3D&trackingId=UkwAXjNwd2r%2Fo7Eqzas6gQ%3D%3D,Data Platform Analyst Intern,Italiaonline,"Assago, Lombardy, Italy","Siamo Italiaonline, la più grande internet company italiana. La nostra mission è diffondere e accelerare la digitalizzazione del nostro Paese per garantire ai nostri Clienti la possibilità di ottenere risultati migliori nella loro vita digitale e nel loro business online attraverso servizi innovativi e di qualità.

La nostra direzione Information Technology ha il compito di supportare i processi dell’azienda attraverso la gestione dell’infrastruttura, lo sviluppo della Data Platform e dei sistemi di supporto al business e delle piattaforme dei nostri prodotti digitali. Garantisce inoltre la governance dei progetti di sviluppo e la sicurezza del nostro patrimonio di dati.
Entrerai a far parte del team IT Data Platform Development, nella nostra direzione Information Technology, come Data Platform Analyst Intern.
contribuire alla creazione, al collaudo e alla manutenzione di pipeline di dati scalabili per l'acquisizione, l'elaborazione e la trasformazione di dati provenienti da differenti fonti
collaborare con team interfunzionali per comprendere i requisiti dei dati e contribuire alla progettazione e all'ottimizzazione dei modelli e dell'architettura dei dati
contribuire all'implementazione della qualità dei dati e dei processi di governance per garantire l'accuratezza, la coerenza e l'affidabilità dei dati
collaborare a stretto contatto con colleghe e colleghi per supportare le loro esigenze e fornire competenze tecniche nell'analisi dei dati
contribuire alla creazione di report per la diffusione della Business Intelligence all'interno dell'azienda
rimanere aggiornati sulle tecnologie emergenti e sulle migliori pratiche di ingegneria dei dati e contribuire alle iniziative di miglioramento continuo all'interno del team.
diploma in informatica o laurea in sistemi informativi, ingegneria o affini
buone capacità di programmazione in linguaggi come Python, SQL
familiarità con i concetti di modellazione dei dati e con i sistemi di database (ad esempio, database relazionali, database NoSQL)
familiarità con le piattaforme cloud (ad esempio, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform) e con tool di reportistica (come PowerBI, Tableu) è considerata un plus.
Cosa offriamo per la tua crescita professionale:
modalità di lavoro ibrida, per garantirti il giusto equilibrio tra lavoro e vita privata
possibilità di entrare in un’azienda italiana che si muove in un contesto digitale in continua trasformazione
percorso “Z Academy” pensato per la tua crescita professionale.

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 9l5.93-4L15 6.54l-6.15 4.2a1.5 1.5 0 01-1.69 0L1 6.54 2.07 5z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Per la nostra sede di Milano (Piazza Trento) siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come CONTRACT DATA ANALYST all’interno della struttura Customer Rating & Contract Management. La struttura ha la principale responsabilità di gestire i contratti stipulati dalla Società con i fornitori di servizi, supportando le competenti Strutture Organizzative di A2A SpA nello screening delle opportunità di mercato e nella definizione delle specifiche contrattuali, nonché monitorando i livelli di servizio e il rispetto degli SLA da parte dei fornitori

A2A Energia. Società del Gruppo A2A che fornisce energia a oltre 2,5 milioni di clienti, costantemente ai vertici delle rilevazioni nazionali per il livello di soddisfazione. Presenza costante per i cittadini, in casa e nella città, porta nel loro mondo comfort e servizi innovativi per favorire l’efficienza energetica e la mobilità elettrica. Si impegna ogni giorno per offrire un servizio di qualità, che risponda alle esigenze più diverse, dal singolo alla grande azienda.

Contribuire al monitoraggio dei fornitori, attraverso la gestione degli applicativi aziendali che registrano l’attività del fornitore. In particolare, è necessario monitorare il corretto svolgimento dell’attività e i dati di pre-fattura, nonché fornire alle strutture preposte i dati di stanziamento e di budget
Predisporre la reportistica di andamento del servizio dei fornitori
Gestire le richieste del business, interfacciandosi con le strutture di A2A Energia e con la struttura Digital e veicolarle verso il fornitore
Predisporre i benestare al pagamento delle fatture, attraverso gli applicativi aziendali

Contribuire alla gestione delle modifiche, degli aggiornamenti e delle implementazioni relative alla documentazione contrattuale (contratti, comunicazioni, modulistica) destinata ai clienti finali di A2A Energia (mercati diversi dal mercato libero) e monitorare l’avanzamento dei ticket, verificare gli UAT (test di prova) e monitorare la messa in produzione delle modifiche apportate.
Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo
Diploma o Laurea in materie scientifiche
Competenze analitiche nella lavorazione ed interpretazione dei dati
Capacità di lettura e comprensione di documentazione contrattuale

Rappresenta un plus l’esperienza pregressa di 1-2 anni nel campo dell’analisi dati in aziende del settore Energy/Utility, Telecomunicazioni o in aziende di consulenza per clienti finali in questi settori
Rappresenta un plus la conoscenza degli applicativi Qlik View, Qlik Sense, Google Cloud Platform o altri linguaggi di programmazione

Completano il profilo: flessibilità, dinamicità, orientamento al teamworking, capacità relazionali con stakeholder interni ed esterni, concretezza e spirito collaborativo, problem solving, proattività e iniziativa, autonomia, gestione dello stress e delle priorità, capacità di analisi e di pianificazione/organizzazione del lavoro.
Flessibilità: settimana lavorativa con venerdì a orario ridotto, flessibilità negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo
column2: Smartworking sino al 60% dell’orario di lavoro su base bimestrale

column1: Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa, supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale

Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialità attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternità/paternità, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori
column2: spazio caregiver, offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti

Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attività sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare

Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano (Piazza Trento) siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come CONTRACT DATA ANALYST all’interno della struttura Customer Rating &
column2: Contract Management. La struttura ha la principale responsabilità di gestire i contratti stipulati dalla Società con i fornitori di servizi, supportando le competenti Strutture Organizzative di A2A SpA nello screening delle opportunità di mercato e nella definizione delle specifiche contrattuali, nonché monitorando i livelli di servizio e il rispetto degli SLA da parte dei fornitori
column3: Per quale Società
column4:
A2A Energia. Società del Gruppo A2A che fornisce energia a oltre 2,5 milioni di clienti, costantemente ai vertici delle rilevazioni nazionali per il livello di soddisfazione. Presenza costante per i cittadini, in casa e nella città, porta nel loro mondo comfort e servizi innovativi per favorire l’efficienza energetica e la mobilità elettrica. Si impegna ogni giorno per offrire un servizio di qualità, che risponda alle esigenze più diverse, dal singolo alla grande azienda.

Ti occuperai di
  • Contribuire al monitoraggio dei fornitori, attraverso la gestione degli applicativi aziendali che registrano l’attività del fornitore. In particolare, è necessario monitorare il corretto svolgimento dell’attività e i dati di pre-fattura, nonché fornire alle strutture preposte i dati di stanziamento e di budget
  • Predisporre la reportistica di andamento del servizio dei fornitori
  • Gestire le richieste del business, interfacciandosi con le strutture di A2A Energia e con la struttura Digital
column5:
e veicolarle verso il fornitore
  • Predisporre i benestare al pagamento delle fatture, attraverso gli applicativi aziendali
  • Contribuire alla gestione delle modifiche, degli aggiornamenti e delle implementazioni relative alla documentazione contrattuale (contratti, comunicazioni, modulistica) destinata ai clienti finali di A2A Energia (mercati diversi dal mercato libero) e monitorare l’avanzamento dei ticket, verificare gli UAT (test di prova) e monitorare la messa in produzione delle modifiche apportate.


    • Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo

    • Competenze analitiche nella lavorazione ed interpretazione dei dati
    • Conoscenza del pacchetto Office (Excel/Access)
    • Capacità di lettura e comprensione di documentazione contrattuale
    • Rappresenta un plus l’esperienza pregressa di 1-2 anni nel campo dell’analisi dati in aziende del settore Energy/Utility, Telecomunicazioni o in aziende di consulenza per clienti finali in questi settori
    • Rappresenta un plus la conoscenza degli applicativi Qlik View, Qlik Sense, Google Cloud Platform o altri linguaggi di programmazione
    • Completano il profilo: flessibilità, dinamicità, orientamento al teamworking, capacità relazionali con stakeholder interni ed esterni, concretezza e spirito collaborativo, problem solving, proattività e iniziativa, autonomia, gestione dello stress e delle priorità, capacità di analisi e di pianificazione/organizzazione del lavoro.

4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=YN7st38WxuT%2BMYiZ9rdiJQ%3D%3D&trackingId=htgkb2LaQgbdTjUgDUr7GA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We’re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We’re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You’ll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito’s team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it’s more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‘Work from anywhere’ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a €8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

We’re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We’re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You’ll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito’s team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it’s more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‘Work from anywhere’ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a €8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

4199463044,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-mainstreaming-4199463044?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=YN7st38WxuT%2BMYiZ9rdiJQ%3D%3D&trackingId=wAXPA88yNDsby4H29wxacQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,MainStreaming,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","MainStreaming® is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment

We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.
Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.

Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2: Master's degree preferred.

column1: 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.
Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.
Execution & Precision: Strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and accuracy in financial reporting.
Ownership & Accountability: Taking responsibility for work, following through on commitments, and delivering high-quality results.
Adaptability & Resilience: Thriving in a fast-paced environment, responding well to change, and maintaining professionalism under pressure.
Collaboration & Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.
A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills

In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

I candidati interessati possono inviare un curriculum vitae con l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi del D.Lgs 196/03 e “Codice in materia di protezione dei dati personali” e dell’art. 13 GDPR 679/16 – “Regolamento europeo sulla protezione dei dati personali”.

MainStreaming® is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment


Data Analyst


Job Description:


We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
  • Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
  • Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
  • Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.
  • Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
  • Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2:
Master's degree preferred.
  • 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
  • Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.


    • Skills:


    • Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
    • Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
    • Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
    • Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
    • Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
    • Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.


    Competencies:


    • Execution &
column3:
Precision: Strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and accuracy in financial reporting.
  • Ownership &
column4:
Accountability: Taking responsibility for work, following through on commitments, and delivering high-quality results.
  • Adaptability &
column5:
Resilience: Thriving in a fast-paced environment, responding well to change, and maintaining professionalism under pressure.
  • Collaboration &
column6:
Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
  • Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.


    • What we offer:


    • A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
    • Flexible working hours.
    • Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
    • Access to E-Learning platform.
    • Health Insurance


    Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills


    In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

    MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

    I candidati interessati possono inviare un curriculum vitae con l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi del D.Lgs 196/03 e “Codice in materia di protezione dei dati personali” e dell’art. 13 GDPR 679/16 – “Regolamento europeo sulla protezione dei dati personali”.

4190828605,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/specialista-processi-e-analisi-di-back-office-at-a2a-4190828605?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=YN7st38WxuT%2BMYiZ9rdiJQ%3D%3D&trackingId=iXFq9F449ZGYtyb4NFKEFw%3D%3D,SPECIALISTA PROCESSI E ANALISI DI BACK OFFICE,A2A,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","

Per la nostra sede di Milano o Brescia siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come Specialista Processi e Analisi di Back Office all’interno del team Back Office Grandi Clienti Energia Elettrica. La struttura ha lo scopo di presidiare, per il segmento di competenza, i processi di acquisizione e gestione nei sistemi commerciali dei contratti a valle dell'accettazione delle offerte e gestire le richieste post vendita, interfacciandosi con altre Strutture di Back Office, Fatturazione e Vendite. La struttura utilizza e gestisce data base relazionali a supporto delle attività.

A2A Energia. Società del Gruppo A2A che fornisce energia a oltre 2,5 milioni di clienti, costantemente ai vertici delle rilevazioni nazionali per il livello di soddisfazione. Presenza costante per i cittadini, in casa e nella città, porta nel loro mondo comfort e servizi innovativi per favorire l’efficienza energetica e la mobilità elettrica. Si impegna ogni giorno per offrire un servizio di qualità, che risponda alle esigenze più diverse, dal singolo alla grande azienda.
Monitoraggio dei processi ed elaborazione/analisi della reportistica operativa e di controllo, verificandone la coerenza e consistenza nella filiera della mappa applicativa
Gestione dei flussi informativi legati alle movimentazioni del portafoglio clienti (nuove contrattualizzazioni, variazioni) interfacciandosi con altre funzioni
Analisi e gestione delle richieste cliente post-vendita
Manutenzione su database relazionali utilizzati a supporto delle analisi sull’anagrafica
Coinvolgimento nelle evoluzioni operative e normative per definire gli adeguamenti dei processi interni e le specifiche degli interventi sui sistemi
Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo
Laurea in materie scientifiche o Diploma tecnico
Esperienza di almeno 2 anni in un ruolo analogo
Preferibile conoscenza di database relazionali Access e MSSQL con basi di programmazione in linguaggio VBA e SQL
Preferibile conoscenza del CRM Salesforce e SAP Billing
Completano il profilo: mente analitica e capacità di analisi dei dati, predisposizione all’attività informatica e alle sue logiche
Flessibilità: settimana lavorativa con venerdì a orario ridotto, flessibilità negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo
column2: Smartworking sino al 60% dell’orario di lavoro su base bimestrale

column1: Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa, supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale

Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialità attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternità/paternità, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori
column2: spazio caregiver, offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti

column1: Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti, gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilità di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna

Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attività sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
Ambiente di lavoro: promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversità, l’equità e l'inclusione (DE&I)
column2: potrai inoltre avere la possibilità di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire come Data Analyst & Management all’interno del team Data Driven Insights. La struttura ha lo scopo di svolgere le analisi dati a supporto delle attività e delle iniziative del Marketing, delle Strutture di vendita, del Customer Service, supportando nell’identificazione delle strategie di business ottimali delle Società della Business Unit Mercato.

L’attività della Business Unit Mercato è finalizzata alla vendita al dettaglio di energia elettrica e di gas naturale ai clienti del mercato libero e alla commercializzazione ai clienti serviti in regime di tutela. Inoltre, si occupa di fornire servizi di efficienza energetica e di mobilità elettrica.
Presidio del data model utilizzato dalla funzione, a supporto delle attività di data exploration delle strutture e propedeutiche alle analisi e allo sviluppo di modelli di Advanced Analytics

Supporto al BU Data Manager nel programma di Data Governance della BU Mercato (redazione e manutenzione del Data Catalog e del Data Dictionary, supporto alla definizione di regole di Data Quality, sostegno al processo di demand di dati, implementazione policy, valutazione pervasività Data Governance, gestione processi di manutenzione del patrimonio informativo…)
Progettazione di query di estrazione e pre-elaborazione dei dati di interesse dalla Data Platform aziendale in cloud (BigQuery su Google Cloud Platform)

Sviluppo di codice per l’elaborazione automatica di dati estratti dalla Data Platform a supporto delle attività di marketing e vendita della società della BU Mercato e la presentazione dei risultati (analisi statistiche, test di ipotesi, studi di correlazione di variabili, valutazione degli intervalli di confidenza associati alle statistiche prodotte, calcolo di indicatori, variabili derivate e KPI di business,…)
Integrazione del data model con dati esterni open source, dati di terze parti o risultati delle analisi o dei modelli di Advanced Analytics
Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo
Esperienza di 2-3 anni in ruolo analogo, preferibilmente in aziende del settore Energy/Utility, Telecomunicazioni o in aziende di consulenza per clienti finali in questi settori
Conoscenza dei principi di Data Governance, Master & Metadata Management, Data Lineage e Data Quality
Preferibile esperienza pratica dei linguaggi R e Python
Capacità di lettura e comprensione di documentazione tecnica in lingua inglese

Rappresenta un plus la conoscenza del framework DAMA, Certificazioni DAMA CDMP, esperienza pratica nell’uso di BigQuery su Google Cloud Platform, esperienza pratica della Data Governance Platform di Informatica
Completano il profilo: curiosità, attitudine all’apprendimento, proattività, predisposizione al lavoro in team e alla condivisione delle informazioni, ottime doti comunicative e relazionali
Flessibilità: settimana lavorativa con venerdì a orario ridotto, flessibilità negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo
column2: Smartworking sino al 60% dell’orario di lavoro su base bimestrale

column2:
Digital,

stiamo cercando una risorsa da inserire nel team Digital Office, responsabile di trovare soluzioni basate sui data e sull’AI con l’obiettivo di potenziare il nostro business, nel ruolo di:


Intern Data Scientist


Principali Attività e Responsabilità:


  • Collaborare con il nostro principale Data Scientist nel disegnare ed implementare Proof of Concepts(PoCs) end-to-end per le nuove iniziative
  • Analizzare Database complessi per estrarre informazioni utili alle decisioni del business
  • Partecipare allo sviluppo dell’AI e di modelli statistici
  • Rimanere aggiornati sui progressi del settore in ambito Data Science e Machine Learning


Competenze e Requisiti:


  • Attualmente studente e/o laurea in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistica e/o affini
  • Conoscenza ed esperienza nel lavoro con dati grezzi e database (ETL)
  • Comprensione degli algoritmi e delle tecniche di Machine Learning
  • Buona padronanza della lingua inglese (Livello B2)
  • Conoscenza del pacchetto Office
  • Proattività e curiosità
  • Problem solving e forti capacità analitiche
  • Voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco in un contesto dinamico e in forte cambiamento


Sede di Lavoro: San Giuliano Milanese (MI) + Smart Working (fino a 3 giorni a settimana)


Orario di Lavoro: 9:00-18:00 dal lunedì al venerdì

4193165137,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-digital-analyst-at-fifty-five-4193165137?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=YN7st38WxuT%2BMYiZ9rdiJQ%3D%3D&trackingId=BkeAC1imvYrcoUoANUo09Q%3D%3D,Junior Digital Analyst,fifty-five,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","A proposito di fifty-five:

fifty-five è una data-company di un nuovo genere che aiuta i brand a sfruttare i dati per migliorare il marketing, i media e l'esperienza del cliente grazie a una combinazione di servizi di consulenza e tecnologia specializzata, pilastro del Brandtech Group nel settore data e marketing, propone un'ampia gamma di servizi che fondono consulenza strategica, services cloud, expertise media e miglioramento della customer experience.

fifty-five conta più di 400 esperti digitali. Consulenti digitali, specialisti di tracking e media, ingegneri e data scientist lavorano in sinergia per fornire consulenze di marketing di alto livello e assistenza tecnica ai brand in tutti i settori, in tutto il mondo.

Come partner fidato degli inserzionisti nella gestione dei dati per la loro raccolta, attivazione e valorizzazione,  supportiamo le organizzazioni nel divenire realtà omnicanale efficaci attraverso la gestione dell'ecosistema digitale e l'integrazione con il mondo fisico.

Con sede a Parigi, operiamo su 3 fusi orari dai nostri 10 uffici situati a Parigi, Londra, Ginevra, Milano, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore e New York. Fifty-five attribuisce particolare importanza al benessere dei suoi collaboratori.

Dopo una fase di onboarding approfondito nel nostro ufficio di Milano, utilizzerete la vostra expertise delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag management systems (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.
In qualità di Junior Digital Analyst, farete leva sulla vostra padronanza tecnica delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag manager (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.
Implementazione tecnica delle soluzioni tracking dei siti web/mobile o app del cliente, dalla raccolta delle esigenze alla raccolta effettiva dei dati di cui garantirete qualità e affidabilità
Gestire i progetti a contatto con il cliente (garantendo l'avanzamento delle missioni, pianificazione, strategia di test, consegne) sulle problematiche di raccolta dati Analytics e Media
Condividere le vostre conoscenze e competenze con i clienti e internamente
Mantenere un collegamento permanente con i diversi attori lato cliente/integratore
Sviluppare un know-how operativo dettagliato (TMS & Analytics)
Sviluppare nuove opportunità di business in collaborazione con i consulenti responsabili del conto
Partecipare alla definizione dei prodotti e degli strumenti interni dell'azienda
Partecipare alla concezione e al posizionamento dell'offerta tecnologica di fifty-five.
Laureato/a in discipline STEM o economia , con 1 o 2 anni di esperienza nella gestione di progetti di Tracking / Misurazione / Web Analytics.
Esperienza nella gestione progetti interfacciandosi con team digitali ed IT
Conoscenza dei principali strumenti di web analytics  (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, AT Internet...)
column2: Tag Management System (GTM, Launch, Tealium, Commanders Act, ...)

column1: Conoscenze di JavaScript (comprensione e sviluppo di logiche semplici) e Web in generale
Grande passione per le tecnologie e il settore di internet
Competenze in ambiente mobile sono un plus
Conoscenze del funzionamento dei CMP sono un plus
Buona capacità di proporre soluzioni perfettamente in linea con le esigenze
Buon livello sia di italiano che di inglese.
I vantaggi di lavorare in fifty-five:
Particolare attenzione all'equilibrio vita privata / vita professionale nel rispetto del diritto alla disconnessione
Un ambiente multiculturale con collaboratori di oltre 20 nazionalità diverse
Valori interni incentrati sull'eccellenza, la benevolenza e la condivisione
Formazione continua (e riconosciuta) sull'ecosistema, le tecnologie digitali e sulle soft skills (es: public speaking, gestione del team ecc.)

Possibilità di partecipare a progetti interni come Data Hive (un progetto ""tech for good"" promosso dai dipendenti di fifty-five, il cui scopo è mettere le loro conoscenze e competenze a disposizione di organizzazioni benefiche), DEI@55 (un gruppo di lavoro sui temi della diversità e dell'inclusione all'interno di fifty-five e della tecnologia più in generale), Sustainability@55 (un team che aiuta a implementare pratiche sostenibili internamente e presso i nostri clienti).

In fifty-five, siamo convinti che la diversità e l'inclusione siano vere forze. Ci impegniamo a garantire parità di trattamento di tutte le candidature ricevute, senza distinzione di genere, età, origine, orientamento sessuale, stato di salute o opinione politica o religiosa. Incontra il team di fifty-five!
Localizzazione: Corso Giacomo Matteotti 1, CAP 20121 Milano
Tipo di contratto: Contratto di lavoro a tempo pieno e indeterminato

4208664133,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-internship-at-allianz-trade-in-italia-4208664133?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=YN7st38WxuT%2BMYiZ9rdiJQ%3D%3D&trackingId=yOMmSfLMUB6wlOVoovbUxQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst Internship,Allianz Trade in Italia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","About Us

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.
What You Should Know Before Applying

At Allianz, we are committed to ensure a fair hiring process and minimize unconscious bias during the screening phase. At this regard, we ask each candidate to submit their resume including only the essential information for an objective and transparent assessment of skills and experience. For example, it’s preferable to omit the photo or the city of residence before submitting the CV.
You will be placed in our Milan/Rome office, within the Transformation team, where you will be responsible for supporting process automation and developing data-driven solutions.
You will be primarily responsible for the following activities:
Collaborate with business analysts or automation engineers to identify opportunities for process improvements.
Provide data-driven recommendations to support the design and implementation of automation solutions.
Assist in the development of models or algorithms for predictive analytics or decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain dashboards and regular reports that provide insights into business processes and the performance of automation systems.
Create visual representations of data that can be understood by stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Automate reporting processes where possible to provide real-time data and insights.
You Are the Ideal Candidate If…
You have proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation, and familiarity with programming languages, primarily Python and VBA.
You are competent with data visualization tools like Power BI and have basic knowledge of automation tools for business processes.
You possess skills in cleaning and preparing datasets for analysis, and experience with Excel or similar tools for data manipulation and analysis.
You have strong problem-solving aptitude to identify issues and propose data-driven solutions, and analytical thinking for evaluating data and process efficiencies.
You have collaboration skills to work effectively across different teams, and time management to handle multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.
Remote working? 10 days per month, plus some days of working from abroad.
360° well-being? We care about your health so you can benefit from dedicated support for your psychophysical well-being.
Discover a flexible and inclusive environment where your peace of mind and personal style truly matter.
Customer and Market Excellence: Unwavering commitment and expertise to provide maximum support to those who rely on us.
Collaborative Leadership: Valuing people, promoting a culture of feedback and collective well-being.
Entrepreneurship: Anticipating trends and taking risks in an environment that fosters innovation and responsibility.
Trust: Acting with integrity, honoring commitments, promoting diversity and inclusion, and acting transparently for corporate social responsibility.

Certified as a Great Place to Work, Allianz Trade Italia is recognized for its focus on Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) issues and for promoting a hybrid work environment that best integrates in-person and smart working modes.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

About Us

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.


What You Should Know Before Applying

At Allianz, we are committed to ensure a fair hiring process and minimize unconscious bias during the screening phase. At this regard, we ask each candidate to submit their resume including only the essential information for an objective and transparent assessment of skills and experience. For example, it’s preferable to omit the photo or the city of residence before submitting the CV.


Your Challenge

You will be placed in our Milan/Rome office, within the Transformation team, where you will be responsible for supporting process automation and developing data-driven solutions.

You will be primarily responsible for the following activities:

  • Collaborate with business analysts or automation engineers to identify opportunities for process improvements.
  • Provide data-driven recommendations to support the design and implementation of automation solutions.
  • Assist in the development of models or algorithms for predictive analytics or decision-making processes.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and regular reports that provide insights into business processes and the performance of automation systems.
  • Create visual representations of data that can be understood by stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
  • Automate reporting processes where possible to provide real-time data and insights.


You Are the Ideal Candidate If…

  • You have proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation, and familiarity with programming languages, primarily Python and VBA.
  • You are competent with data visualization tools like Power BI and have basic knowledge of automation tools for business processes.
  • You possess skills in cleaning and preparing datasets for analysis, and experience with Excel or similar tools for data manipulation and analysis.
  • You have strong problem-solving aptitude to identify issues and propose data-driven solutions, and analytical thinking for evaluating data and process efficiencies.
  • You have collaboration skills to work effectively across different teams, and time management to handle multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.


Why Working With Us?

  • Remote working? 10 days per month, plus some days of working from abroad.
  • 360° well-being? We care about your health so you can benefit from dedicated support for your psychophysical well-being.
  • Discover a flexible and inclusive environment where your peace of mind and personal style truly matter.


Our Values

  • Customer and Market Excellence: Unwavering commitment and expertise to provide maximum support to those who rely on us.
  • Collaborative Leadership: Valuing people, promoting a culture of feedback and collective well-being.
  • Entrepreneurship: Anticipating trends and taking risks in an environment that fosters innovation and responsibility.
  • Trust: Acting with integrity, honoring commitments, promoting diversity and inclusion, and acting transparently for corporate social responsibility.


Certified as a Great Place to Work, Allianz Trade Italia is recognized for its focus on Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) issues and for promoting a hybrid work environment that best integrates in-person and smart working modes.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

4202657412,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-nexid-4202657412?position=10&pageNum=2&refId=YN7st38WxuT%2BMYiZ9rdiJQ%3D%3D&trackingId=GT4%2FS%2Bt1mRmAua2ZZ7ONRg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,NEXiD,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","NEXiD è una digital company che supporta le aziende nella trasformazione digitale attraverso progetti end to end. Il modus operandi che ci distingue è: from vision to execution.
Laurea in una delle seguenti discipline: Informatica, Fisica, Ingegneria Matematica, Ingegneria Gestionale, Matematica, Statistica, Economia o affini.
Esperienza in attività di estrazione, pulizia, modellazione e analisi dei dati utilizzando strumenti e linguaggi comunemente impiegati nel settore, come Microsoft Excel, SQL e Python.
Capacità di utilizzare le principali librerie Python per la manipolazione dei dati come Pandas e Matplotlib
Capacità di scrivere query complesse, inclusivo dell’uso di JOIN.
(Nice to have) Familiarità con la creazione di stored procedures.
Buona padronanza di Microsoft Excel, incluso l’utilizzo delle tabelle pivot e strumenti di analisi dati.
Conoscenza ed esperienza pratica nell’utilizzo di Power BI:
(Nice to have) Capacità di progettare modelli semantici.
(Nice to have) Conoscenza di altri strumenti di visualizzazione dati come Tableau o Qlik.
Capacità di comunicare in modo chiaro e strutturato i ragionamenti e le logiche sottostanti ai dati analizzati, traducendoli in insight comprensibili per gli stakeholder.
Saranno considerate come valore aggiunto alcune soft skill che contraddistinguono i nostri collaboratori:
Avrai inoltre la possibilità di lavorare fin da subito a contatto con i nostri clienti, inoltre il tuo lavoro sarà adeguatamente seguito e supportato dal Management NEXiD.
Avrai accesso a formazione sulle metodologie, i tool e le tecnologie usate in NEXiD e potrai ottenere svariate certificazioni.
Se sei un talento che vuole contribuire fin dal primo giorno all’innovazione, sei nel posto giusto!

NEXiD è una digital company che supporta le aziende nella trasformazione digitale attraverso progetti end to end. Il modus operandi che ci distingue è: from vision to execution.

Posizione:

Per NEXiD cerchiamo: DATA ANALYST

Requisiti:

IL PROFILO CHE CERCHIAMO

“Perché sceglieremo te”

  • Laurea in una delle seguenti discipline: Informatica, Fisica, Ingegneria Matematica, Ingegneria Gestionale, Matematica, Statistica, Economia o affini.
  • Esperienza in attività di estrazione, pulizia, modellazione e analisi dei dati utilizzando strumenti e linguaggi comunemente impiegati nel settore, come Microsoft Excel, SQL e Python.
  • Capacità di utilizzare le principali librerie Python per la manipolazione dei dati come Pandas e Matplotlib
  • Capacità di scrivere query complesse, inclusivo dell’uso di JOIN.
  • (Nice to have) Familiarità con la creazione di stored procedures.
  • Buona padronanza di Microsoft Excel, incluso l’utilizzo delle tabelle pivot e strumenti di analisi dati.
  • Conoscenza ed esperienza pratica nell’utilizzo di Power BI:
    • Creazione di report/dashboard interattive
    • Utilizzo del linguaggio DAX
    • (Nice to have) Capacità di progettare modelli semantici.
  • (Nice to have) Conoscenza di altri strumenti di visualizzazione dati come Tableau o Qlik.
  • Capacità di comunicare in modo chiaro e strutturato i ragionamenti e le logiche sottostanti ai dati analizzati, traducendoli in insight comprensibili per gli stakeholder.

Saranno considerate come valore aggiunto alcune soft skill che contraddistinguono i nostri collaboratori:

  • Orientamento al lifelong learning
  • Adattabilità
  • Capacità di team work
  • Comunicazione efficace e costruttiva
  • Proattività e autonomia
  • Tech enthusiasm

Altre informazioni:

COSA OFFRIAMO

“Perché scegliere noi”

  • Avrai inoltre la possibilità di lavorare fin da subito a contatto con i nostri clienti, inoltre il tuo lavoro sarà adeguatamente seguito e supportato dal Management NEXiD.
  • Avrai accesso a formazione sulle metodologie, i tool e le tecnologie usate in NEXiD e potrai ottenere svariate certificazioni.

SEDE DI LAVORO: Milano (ibrido)

INQUADRAMENTO:

  • CCNL Metalmeccanici
  • Contratto di Stage o Apprendistato

Se sei un talento che vuole contribuire fin dal primo giorno all’innovazione, sei nel posto giusto!
