Are you an Automotive fan and you have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements, and in this way support dealers to reach growth opportunities? Would you like to be part of a renowned Automotive company, applying your professional skills and gain experience? Then we might be looking for you!
The main purpose of the Data Analyst is:
support the parts sales team and Parts Managers
collect, collate and analyse various internal and external composite data
identify and prioritise parts sales growth opportunities at National & Dealer levels.
Identification and collation of key data from both internal and external sources
Analysis of data, identifying key opportunities for parts sales growth at both National and Dealer levels.
Collect and provide market intelligence and analysis to assist formulation of current and future parts sales marketing strategy
Ongoing analysis and reporting from all programme channels and activities
Focus at all times to achieve nationally set KPI and €’s growth objectives
Assist in the building of MSX programme tools, ensuring ongoing correct usage and fit for purpose
Direct communications link between programme activity and client management
Attend and contribute to regular programme meetings
Ensure effective communication and feedback with all parts (MSXI – MSX Italy team – BMW)
Ensure timely and accurate reporting as per programme requirements
Attend other meetings as required, providing results, feedback and market intelligence
Cooperate and collaborate (Team working and team building)
Training for new analyst (training on the job)
Inform the Sales Reps, Parts Manager, Project Coordinator and Project Manager about the critical situations
Take care of the company assets (usage in line with company policies, managing and maintenance)
Correct and professional implementation of the project
Propose project improvements (new implementation tools and activities, training material, etc.)
Provide a good level of job
Inform Parts Managers, Project Coordinator, PM and BMW on achievements or concerns within ongoing activities
High level of literacy and numeracy -
High level of computer literacy, especially MS Excel and MS Access
Ability to design and deliver Microsoft Word and PowerPoint Presentations
Degree in engineering, economics, business administration or statistic.
Previous experiences in the same role are appreciated.

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Are you an Automotive fan and you have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements, and in this way support dealers to reach growth opportunities? Purpose Of The Position

  • identify and prioritise parts sales growth opportunities at National &

Spiccata flessibilità, pro-attività, passione per la tecnologia

Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Roma, Salerno, Torino

NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, è tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services. Con più di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicità, talento ed attitudine. Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l’ascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorità. Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunità e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.

Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!

www.nttdata.com/it

Responsibilities

Il candidato ideale avrà la responsabilità di disegnare e realizzare sistemi di Enterprise Datawarehouse e di BI, per diversi mercati, e sarà coinvolto in task di analisi e di sviluppo.

  • Avrà esperienza di almeno 2 anni nella modellazione e nell’acquisizione di dati eterogenei da riconciliare, strutturati e non, e nella loro organizzazione per supportare funzionalità di Reporting and Analytics

4195970492,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-intern-at-alkemy-enabling-evolution-4195970492?position=8&pageNum=5&refId=mG7i8SjKFizfCbOcjAX7Pg%3D%3D&trackingId=Sbz5qHvK8m6aMthISWPr%2Bg%3D%3D,Data Scientist Intern,Alkemy enabling evolution,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Data Scientist Intern
Alkemy è una società internazionale specializzata nell’evoluzione del modello di business di grandi e medie aziende e una public company quotata sul mercato MTA STAR di Borsa Italiana.

La nostra mission è di migliorare la posizione di mercato e la competitività delle grandi e medie aziende stimolando l’evoluzione del modello di business in coerenza con l’innovazione tecnologica e i comportamenti dei consumatori. Grazie a un team di oltre 1000 persone, integriamo competenze nelle aree di Strategy, Communication, Design, Performance, Technology, Insights & Analytics con un’offerta, pensata per il contesto post-digital, che copre l’intera catena del valore dalla strategia all’implementazione.

Per il potenziamento dell’area di Data & Analytics (former Nunatac SpA), Alkemy è alla ricerca di un Neolaureati e Laureandi da inserire come Data Scientist Intern. La Mission di questa area è di accompagnare le aziende nel loro percorso di crescita, aiutandole a fondare la propria strategia sui dati e sulla conoscenza che da essi deriva. È composta da Data Scientists e Data Engineers che formano un team dinamico, informale e rigoroso al lavoro su applicazioni di Advanced Analytics innovative e di valore.

Lavorare nell’area Data & Analytics significa affrontare tutte le sfide legate all'uso di metodi quantitativi, dalle tecniche statistiche consolidate agli approcci pionieristici di Machine Learning e Deep Learning applicati ai Big Data, per ottenere un impatto reale sul business dei nostri clienti. Siamo in continua crescita e cerchiamo nuove persone che sappiano combinare le competenze tecniche con la visione, l'intraprendenza e la passione per i dati.
Esperienza: Neolaureati o laureandi (meno di 6 mesi dalla prova finale)
Laurea in ambito scientifico (statistica, matematica, fisica, economia. informatica)
Forte interesse in ambito gestione ed analisi dei dati, data visualization, advanced analytics, machine/deep learning
Ottima capacità di lavorare in gruppo
Conoscenza di SQL e, anche base, del mondo SAS, R e Python
Stage retribuito finalizzato all'inserimento in Azienda.

In Alkemy ci impegniamo costantemente nel creare le migliori condizioni affinché tutte le nostre persone sentano di poter esprimere al meglio il proprio valore ed il proprio talento - e possano sentire Alkemy come casa propria - indipendentemente da genere, età, nazionalità, orientamento sessuale e religioso.

Siamo da sempre profondamente convinti che un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo che valorizzi tutte le diversità sia non solo un imperativo valoriale, ma un fattore critico di successo per il nostro business. Aggreghiamo sotto lo stesso tetto persone con professionalità e background molto diversi e da sempre promuoviamo una cultura di condivisione e crescita continua.

Eccellenza, Passione, Integrità e Concretezza sono i valori fondanti di Alkemy, che tutti noi condividiamo e che ci guidano nel realizzare la nostra mission. I valori Alkemy definiscono la nostra identità e sono alla base della nostra cultura organizzativa, indirizzano i nostri comportamenti nei confronti di tutte le nostre persone e dei nostri clienti, costruendo evolutivamente il nostro approccio al business.

I profili ritenuti in linea verranno contattati entro 20 giorni. Non saranno valutate candidature sprovviste di cv completo allegato. I dati dei candidati verranno trattati ai sensi dell’Informativa Privacy sempre consultabile sul nostro sito.alkemy.com

Data Scientist Intern


Alkemy è una società internazionale specializzata nell’evoluzione del modello di business di grandi e medie aziende e una public company quotata sul mercato MTA STAR di Borsa Italiana.

La nostra mission è di migliorare la posizione di mercato e la competitività delle grandi e medie aziende stimolando l’evoluzione del modello di business in coerenza con l’innovazione tecnologica e i comportamenti dei consumatori. Grazie a un team di oltre 1000 persone, integriamo competenze nelle aree di Strategy, Communication, Design, Performance, Technology, Insights &
column2:
Analytics con un’offerta, pensata per il contesto post-digital, che copre l’intera catena del valore dalla strategia all’implementazione.


IL RUOLO


Per il potenziamento dell’area di Data &
column3:
Analytics (former Nunatac SpA), Alkemy è alla ricerca di un Neolaureati e Laureandi da inserire come Data Scientist Intern. La Mission di questa area è di accompagnare le aziende nel loro percorso di crescita, aiutandole a fondare la propria strategia sui dati e sulla conoscenza che da essi deriva. È composta da Data Scientists e Data Engineers che formano un team dinamico, informale e rigoroso al lavoro su applicazioni di Advanced Analytics innovative e di valore.

Lavorare nell’area Data &
column4:
Analytics significa affrontare tutte le sfide legate all'uso di metodi quantitativi, dalle tecniche statistiche consolidate agli approcci pionieristici di Machine Learning e Deep Learning applicati ai Big Data, per ottenere un impatto reale sul business dei nostri clienti. Siamo in continua crescita e cerchiamo nuove persone che sappiano combinare le competenze tecniche con la visione, l'intraprendenza e la passione per i dati.


Sede di lavoro: Milano

Esperienza: Neolaureati o laureandi (meno di 6 mesi dalla prova finale)

Area: Data &
column5:
Analytics


REQUISITI NECESSARI


  • Laurea in ambito scientifico (statistica, matematica, fisica, economia. informatica)
  • Forte interesse in ambito gestione ed analisi dei dati, data visualization, advanced analytics, machine/deep learning
  • Curiosità e proattività
  • Ottima capacità di lavorare in gruppo
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese


NICE TO HAVE


  • Conoscenza di SQL e, anche base, del mondo SAS, R e Python


Stage retribuito finalizzato all'inserimento in Azienda.


COSA OFFRIAMO


In Alkemy ci impegniamo costantemente nel creare le migliori condizioni affinché tutte le nostre persone sentano di poter esprimere al meglio il proprio valore ed il proprio talento - e possano sentire Alkemy come casa propria - indipendentemente da genere, età, nazionalità, orientamento sessuale e religioso.

Siamo da sempre profondamente convinti che un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo che valorizzi tutte le diversità sia non solo un imperativo valoriale, ma un fattore critico di successo per il nostro business. Aggreghiamo sotto lo stesso tetto persone con professionalità e background molto diversi e da sempre promuoviamo una cultura di condivisione e crescita continua.

Eccellenza, Passione, Integrità e Concretezza sono i valori fondanti di Alkemy, che tutti noi condividiamo e che ci guidano nel realizzare la nostra mission. I valori Alkemy definiscono la nostra identità e sono alla base della nostra cultura organizzativa, indirizzano i nostri comportamenti nei confronti di tutte le nostre persone e dei nostri clienti, costruendo evolutivamente il nostro approccio al business.

4187704643,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-geo-analytics-iv-remote-at-agile-lab-4187704643?position=9&pageNum=5&refId=mG7i8SjKFizfCbOcjAX7Pg%3D%3D&trackingId=V%2BSmPmQxtKEf3VCy%2Bgbr%2BA%3D%3D,Data Analyst - Geo Analytics IV (Remote),Agile Lab,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Agile Lab is a company founded in 2014 with the mission to create value for its customers in data-intensive environments through customizable solutions that establish performance-driven processes, sustainable architectures, and automated platforms based on data governance best practices.

Having delivered over 100 successful Elite Data Engineering initiatives, we have used this experience to create Witboost: a modular, technology-agnostic platform that enables modern organizations to discover, value, and produce their data in both traditional environments and fully compliant Data Mesh architectures.
With a highly skilled team of over 220 data engineers based in Europe, Agile Lab helps organizations with their data-driven transformation.
Take a look at our handbook to discover our core values and processes.
We are looking for a Data Analyst - Geo Analytics IV to join our team.
Analyze and interpret large datasets, particularly geospatial data, to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain geo-analytics systems using platforms like ESRI ArcGIS and other GIS tools.
Design workflows and processes for data collection, cleaning, and analysis of geospatial data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate geospatial data into broader business strategies.
Assist in the creation of visual representations (maps, dashboards) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
Mentor junior team members in data analysis techniques and geospatial tools.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in geo-analytics and data science.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Math, Computer Science or a related field.
+ 6 years of previous experience in analyzing geospatial data and working with GIS platforms (ArcGIS, QGIS).
Proficiency in programming languages like Python and JavaScript for data analysis and web development.
Strong knowledge of SQL, PostgreSQL, and spatial databases (PostGIS).
Experience with open-source geospatial technologies and tools (GeoServer, OpenLayers).
Understanding of data visualization techniques and experience building dashboards.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions.
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate across teams.
Proactivity and willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.
Full Remote or hybrid working in our offices: Milan, Turin, Padua, Bologna, Catania and Rende
A structured career path with clear expectations and salary for each level
Support of a buddy in the first week of work
A coach as a guide in choosing the most suitable experiences for your ambitions
Benefits and corporate welfare programs: company prizes and welcome pack with all the equipment you need to work
Agile Nomads Experience: opportunity to work for 2 weeks abroad
Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you
The opportunity to attend one conference per year
A company rated 4.8 out of 5 for employee satisfaction on Glassdoor and certified as a Great Place to Work
Inclusive environment where you can be who you really are
Stimulating environment oriented to growth, both professional and personal.
Remote or smart working and work life balance
Training monthly budget: advanced training available
A structured career path with clear expectations and salary for each level
Welcome pack with all the equipment you need to work
The opportunity to attend one conference per year
Inclusive environment where you can be who you really are
Stimulating environment oriented to growth, both professional and personal.
We don't like hierarchies: we work as a team
We don't like bureaucracies, we prefer a sense of responsibility
We like data, certainly, so anything that is measurable
We want to make a positive change in our industry
Empathy, humility, collaboration, and willingness to challenge ourselves are the basis of our work.

This position is open to all candidates, regardless of gender, and we strongly encourage applications from both male and female candidates pursuant to Art. 27 of Legislative Decree no. 198/2006, as well as those who identify themselves as non-binary or of any other kind. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Agile Lab is a company founded in 2014 with the mission to create value for its customers in data-intensive environments through customizable solutions that establish performance-driven processes, sustainable architectures, and automated platforms based on data governance best practices.

Having delivered over 100 successful Elite Data Engineering initiatives, we have used this experience to create Witboost: a modular, technology-agnostic platform that enables modern organizations to discover, value, and produce their data in both traditional environments and fully compliant Data Mesh architectures.

With a highly skilled team of over 220 data engineers based in Europe, Agile Lab helps organizations with their data-driven transformation.

Take a look at our handbook to discover our core values and processes.

💼The opportunity:

We are looking for a Data Analyst - Geo Analytics IV to join our team.

💰RAL:

€ 60K –70K + 4K bonus pack

💻Responsibilities:

  • Analyze and interpret large datasets, particularly geospatial data, to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
  • Develop and maintain geo-analytics systems using platforms like ESRI ArcGIS and other GIS tools.
  • Design workflows and processes for data collection, cleaning, and analysis of geospatial data.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate geospatial data into broader business strategies.
  • Assist in the creation of visual representations (maps, dashboards) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
  • Mentor junior team members in data analysis techniques and geospatial tools.
  • Stay up to date with the latest developments in geo-analytics and data science.

🛠️Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Math, Computer Science or a related field.
  • + 6 years of previous experience in analyzing geospatial data and working with GIS platforms (ArcGIS, QGIS).
  • Proficiency in programming languages like Python and JavaScript for data analysis and web development.
  • Strong knowledge of SQL, PostgreSQL, and spatial databases (PostGIS).
  • Experience with open-source geospatial technologies and tools (GeoServer, OpenLayers).
  • Understanding of data visualization techniques and experience building dashboards.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate across teams.
  • Proactivity and willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.

🛠️ Responsibilities:

  • Full Remote or hybrid working in our offices: Milan, Turin, Padua, Bologna, Catania and Rende

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

NATO’s Public Diplomacy efforts serve a vital function within the Alliance by communicating its purpose and priorities to audiences worldwide. In fulfilling this role, the Public Diplomacy Division (PDD) actively strengthens NATO’s public image, thereby fostering trust in and support for the Alliance. The Division also acts as coordinator for strategic communication activities across all NATO civilian and military bodies and commands.

The Data Insights and Information Threats section sits within PDD. It comprises the Information Environment Assessment (IEA) Unit, Audience Research Team, and a team managing strategic communications policy and NATO’s work on countering information threats. The Information Environment Assessment Unit, comprised of an Analysis and a Data Team, is the engine that provides data and evidence-based analysis of, and insights into, the information environment. The Unit develops action-orientated reporting and alerting to help NATO improve its Strategic Communications, as well as engagement with relevant stakeholders internally and externally.

The incumbent carries out the duties of IEA Data Analyst in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. They are responsible for applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of multiple publicly and commercially available data sources and services. Additionally, the incumbent produces analytical products with actionable recommendations, supporting data-driven decision making and helping to ensure a strategic approach to PDD’s multifaceted communications. They also help to shape the acquisition and adoption of cutting-edge analytical tools to help NATO’s IEA capability evolve.
possess a university degree, from an institute of a recognized standing, in a field relevant for the role (preferably such as data science or international relations)
have 2 years of professional experience in data analytics, and qualitative and quantitative research methods
possess proven experience applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of traditional and social media
possess proven experience in developing reporting products for senior and/or executive audiences
be able to explain data as a convincing story
have excellent communication, drafting and oral presentation skills
have strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact within a multicultural team and with diverse stakeholders across the Organization
possess the following minimum levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): V (“Advanced”) in one
column2: I (“Beginner”) in the other.

column1: The following would be considered an advantage:
experience with quantitative methods and their application to trend analysis
basic knowledge of programming languages, such as Python
geographic expertise (Russia, China or/and Middle East North Africa)
experience with methods and techniques to evaluate and assess communications activities, including relevant measurement and assessment frameworks and tools

knowledge of and/or experience in analysing information threats, using publicly and commercially available data sources and services to characterize threat actors’ campaigns, capabilities, and their tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs)
knowledge of and/or experience in implementing best-practice analytical methodologies to structure and scale data models for analysing information threats.

Contribute in an active, timely and well-coordinated manner to PDD’s work in the area of Information Environment Assessment, by delivering high quality reports including actionable recommendations based on the assessment of the information environment. Glean and share insights with PDD leadership on information threats targeting NATO.

Keep abreast of industry developments relevant to Information Environment Assessment, including emerging best practice analytical methodologies. Provide clear insight and recommendations to civilian and military staffs from multiple disciplines, including those directly responsible for analysing and evaluating information and communications products. Ensure that this expertise is translated into effective Information Environment Assessments reporting. Use sound political judgement when making recommendations on adjusting NATO’s communications based on regular analysis and assessment.

Apply data analytics to the collection and analysis of traditional and social media. Contribute to improving the quality, scope and operational relevance of the IEA reports delivered by PDD. Identify and analyse trends, and distil actionable insights to brief NATO communicators and decision-makers. Test traditional media, social media and disinformation analysis tools and advise on procurement and contracted services.

Work closely with the IEA Unit, Audience Research Team and StratCom policy team within the section to integrate IEA into the communications planning process and coordinate seamlessly with other sections within PDD. Develop and maintain professional relationships across the civilian and military staff to promote synergies within and between different disciplines, including intelligence, cyber, operations, data policy, logistics, and information management. Work with Allies and partners, including the European External Acton Service and G7 Rapid Response Mechanism, to exchange expertise related to analysing information threats. Coordinate effectively with various stakeholders in order to get useful inputs with actionable recommendations for the delivery of regular IEA reports. Identify, strengthen and build relationships with partners, researchers and other experts to become better informed on IEA.

Plan and deliver reports within tight deadlines on issues of relevance to PDD and senior NATO leadership. Demonstrate political acumen when selecting topics and analysing and assessing trends in the information environment. Work with other divisions at NATO to deliver briefings for senior NATO staff. Use initiative to recommend opportunities for Information Environment Assessment.
Perform any other related duty as assigned.

The incumbent carries out their duties under the overall direction of the Head, Information Environment Assessment Unit, and following day-to-day guidance of the Lead, Data Team . The incumbent maintains a close working relationship with other staff in the Unit, members of PDD, as well as counterparts in other Divisions, other NATO entities and in Allied Delegations and capitals.
Clarity and Accuracy: Checks own work.
Customer Service Orientation: Takes personal responsibility for correcting problems.
Empathy: Is open to others’ perspectives.
Impact and Influence: Takes multiple actions to persuade.
Initiative: Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation.
Teamwork: Solicits inputs and encourages others
Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years
column2: possibility of renewal for up to three years, during which the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite duration contract.

column1: In accordance with the contract policy, this is a post in which turnover is desirable for political reasons in order to be able to accommodate the Organisation's need to carry out its tasks as mandated by the Nations in a changing environment, for example by maintaining the flexibility necessary to shape the Organisation's skills profile, and to ensure appropriate international diversity.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO’s member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.
Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Régulations.
USEFUL INFORMATION REGARDING APPLICATION AND RECRUITMENT PROCESS
Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:
For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link )
Before you apply to any position, we encourage you to click here and watch our video providing 6 tips to prepare you for your application and recruitment process.
Do you have questions on the application process in the system and not sure how to proceed? Click here for a video containing the information you need to successfully submit your application on time.
More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate), approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser, verification of your study(ies) and work experience, and the successful completion of the accreditation and notification process by the relevant authorities.

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. NATO reserves the right to screen applications to identify the use of such tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO’s sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.

NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply. NATO is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible working environment, where all candidates living with disabilities can fully participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require reasonable accommodation, please inform us during your selection process. Candidates will be required to provide documented medical evidence to support their request for accommodation. Building Integrity is a key element of NATO’s core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work. Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with. Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements. The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours. The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements. Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment. For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab. NATO does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. For more info please click here .

Contract clause applicable:

In accordance with the contract policy, this is a post in which turnover is desirable for political reasons in order to be able to accommodate the Organisation's need to carry out its tasks as mandated by the Nations in a changing environment, for example by maintaining the flexibility necessary to shape the Organisation's skills profile, and to ensure appropriate international diversity.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO’s member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.

Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Régulations.

  • USEFUL INFORMATION REGARDING APPLICATION AND RECRUITMENT PROCESS


Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:

For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link )
column18:
For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment

Before you apply to any position, we encourage you to click here and watch our video providing 6 tips to prepare you for your application and recruitment process.

Do you have questions on the application process in the system and not sure how to proceed? Click here for a video containing the information you need to successfully submit your application on time.

More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate), approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser, verification of your study(ies) and work experience, and the successful completion of the accreditation and notification process by the relevant authorities.

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. NATO reserves the right to screen applications to identify the use of such tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO’s sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.

  • ADDITIONAL INFORMATION


NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply. NATO is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible working environment, where all candidates living with disabilities can fully participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require reasonable accommodation, please inform us during your selection process. Candidates will be required to provide documented medical evidence to support their request for accommodation. Building Integrity is a key element of NATO’s core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work. Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with. Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements. The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours. The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements. Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment. For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab. NATO does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. For more info please click here .

4205945822,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-sibling-4205945822?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=W67Z3S8fSgs%2FeWOKykR3Pg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,SIBLING,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Silbing is working with a leading organisation in Brussels looking for a Data Analyst to join on a 6-month contract (with likely extension). A great chance to shape high-impact projects in a fast-paced, international setting.
You’ll work with large datasets, build dashboards, and deliver insights that directly support strategic decisions
Analyse complex data to uncover trends and insights
Build and optimise dashboards (Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
Work closely with stakeholders to understand requirements
Excellent communication – English essential, Dutch/French a bonus

Silbing is working with a leading organisation in Brussels looking for a Data Analyst to join on a 6-month contract (with likely extension). A great chance to shape high-impact projects in a fast-paced, international setting.


The role:


You’ll work with large datasets, build dashboards, and deliver insights that directly support strategic decisions


Key responsibilities:


  • Analyse complex data to uncover trends and insights
  • Build and optimise dashboards (Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
  • Work closely with stakeholders to understand requirements
  • Translate data into clear recommendations
  • Support data quality initiatives


Requirements


  • 3+ years as a Data Analyst
  • Strong SQL and Excel
  • Experience with modern BI tools
  • Excellent communication – English essential, Dutch/French a bonus
  • Proactive and independent mindset

4183639369,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-power-bi-at-laco-4183639369?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=5nCaiGyhwuh9h7vIv6zUVw%3D%3D,Data Analyst - Power BI,LACO,"Flemish Region, Belgium","Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.

Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.
Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:
Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.
Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.
Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.
We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …
Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!
Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!


Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data &
column2:

Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.


Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

  • Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
  • Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
  • Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
  • Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
  • Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
  • Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
  • Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.


Jouw vaardigheden

  • Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.

Ons aanbod

  • We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
  • Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
  • Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
  • Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
  • Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …


Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met ons Talent Acquisition-team en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

4206093396,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-data-visualisation-at-norriq-financial-services-4206093396?position=9&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=RfdOIgU%2FjgemIngblliaVg%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Data Visualisation,NORRIQ Financial Services,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultant

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.
Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank’s digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization
Master’s degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.
Technical Expertise & Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS (nice to have), Python & R (to support our AI team), Reporting & Visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge: AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.

column2: ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.

column1: Languages: Fluent in English and native in French or Dutch.
Dynamic Work Environment: High-impact projects with leading financial institutions in a fast-growing consulting firm.
Career Development: Continuous learning and growth opportunities to advance your career.
Collaborative Culture: A supportive, innovative team environment that encourages new ideas and professional development.
Global Exposure: International experience working on cross-border projects that shape the financial services industry.

At NORRIQ, we are shaping the future of finance through transformation and innovation. If you're passionate about improving financial processes, driving change, and delivering value to clients, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultant

Who We Are

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.

The Opportunity

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.

Responsibilities

  • Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
  • Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank’s digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
  • Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
  • Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
  • Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
  • Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization

Your Profile

  • Master’s degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
  • 1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.

4202456599,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-koda-staff-4202456599?position=10&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=v%2BQWmnwDE1OFe7S%2F4hMPiA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Koda Staff,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Title: Permanent Data Analyst
Location: Brussels (3 days per week onsite)

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong technical background, the ability to work with complex data, and experience engaging with multiple stakeholders.
Work within a feature team, analyzing large and complex datasets.
Write and optimize Python and SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
Utilize ETL processes and work within Azure Databricks.
Collaborate closely with Data Engineers and other technical teams.
Interpret and translate business needs into actionable insights.
Engage with multiple stakeholders across different departments.
Ensure data accuracy and contribute to decision-making processes.
4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with complex datasets.
Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, ETL, and Azure Databricks.
Ability to understand and dive into the technical aspect of data pipelines and code.
Experience working in large teams rather than small teams with a single analyst.
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain technical insights in a business-friendly manner.
Retail industry experience or a strong affinity for customer-related data.
Fluency in English and French (spoken and written).
Experience working with cloud platforms and modern data infrastructures.
Familiarity with customer analytics and behavioral data.
First stage: Interview with HR and CTO.
Second stage: Technical interview with team members.

Job Title: Permanent Data Analyst


Location: Brussels (3 days per week onsite)

Languages: English &
column2:
French

Seniority Level: 4+ years of experience

Reports to: Head of Analytics


About the Role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong technical background, the ability to work with complex data, and experience engaging with multiple stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities

  • Work within a feature team, analyzing large and complex datasets.
  • Write and optimize Python and SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
  • Utilize ETL processes and work within Azure Databricks.
  • Collaborate closely with Data Engineers and other technical teams.
  • Interpret and translate business needs into actionable insights.
  • Engage with multiple stakeholders across different departments.
  • Ensure data accuracy and contribute to decision-making processes.


Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with complex datasets.
  • Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, ETL, and Azure Databricks.
  • Ability to understand and dive into the technical aspect of data pipelines and code.
  • Experience working in large teams rather than small teams with a single analyst.
  • Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain technical insights in a business-friendly manner.
  • Retail industry experience or a strong affinity for customer-related data.
  • Fluency in English and French (spoken and written).


Nice-to-Have

  • Experience working with cloud platforms and modern data infrastructures.
  • Familiarity with customer analytics and behavioral data.


Interview Process

  1. First stage: Interview with HR and CTO.
  2. Second stage: Technical interview with team members.

4198440376,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/crm-data-analyst-at-nestl%C3%A9-nespresso-sa-4198440376?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=%2Fcy8CYrFSNeU4rxx9umX4A%3D%3D,CRM Data Analyst,Nestlé Nespresso SA,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","CRM Data Analyst, this is your challenge

Do you have a passion for data, insights, and coffee? Do you want to work together with energized teams towards the most performing plans for the Belux market? By joining our CX&I team, you will be in charge of customers insights, be the database guardian and also further optimize our analytics corner.
A day in the life of a CRM Data Analyst:
In charge of monthly B2C & B2B CRM reporting from basic KPIs to forecasting net acquisition.
Perform statistical analysis through different tools (Nespresso is working with Adobe, Knime, Snowflake, PowerBI) and present recommendations to the business.
Optimize analytical worklfows through automation and forecasting with pre-built data science tools.
Maintain DataHub knowledge & documentation, share best pratices and be the first point of contact locally.
Lead & implement the new Martech solution followed by continuous improvement in usage & roll-out.
Lead yearly deep dives across departments (collect requests, time & build & deliver analytics to stakeholders).
Adhoc analysis for internal departments (boutique, e-sales, trade, B2B), both re-actively and pro-actively.

The Nespresso Marketing team consists of 17 persons operating in 4 distinct teams: Brand, Product, B2B and Customer experience & insights. You would be part of the later one which is a dynamic analytical team of 5 persons. The CX&I team collaborates with all the departments (Channels, Demand & supply, B2C,..) to nurture the company with insights thanks to Nespresso’s direct to consumer model. Our team is also the guardian of net acquisition and subscription on top of insights.
Degree in mathematics/statistics, or economic studies with large quantitative component.
More than 3 years of experience in data / analytics related activities in a business-oriented environment.
Understand SQL language & Snowflake (or having experience in coding).
Master OS office (Excel, Powerpoint, Word) and Power BI.
You have an open mindset and enjoy discovering new tools & approaches.
Knowledge about Adobe campaign and Adobe experience platform is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch and/or French AND English is mandatory.
A full-time position located in Brussels.
Excellent benefits, including an annual target bonus.
A variety of professional trainings and development programs.
Various career opportunities, both in Benelux and internationally.
Professional working environment, team spirit, company pride and passionate colleagues.
You will contribute to make Belux a better coffee place
Our recruiters would be glad to ask any pending questions. Feel free to send your questions to careers@be.nestle.com and you will receive an answer within 3 working days.
Applying for the role of CRM Data Analyst?
Great! If you see a match with the description as described above, we will gladly receive your cv and motivation. You can upload these via the link.

We use an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Tool to schedule interviews with our candidates. So keep an eye on your email for the interview invitation! When registering your application, you will be asked if we may send you whatsapp messages
column2: if you answer 'yes' to this, you will receive communication via whatsapp in addition to messages via email. Communication through our AI tool is in English, but our recruiters speak Dutch, English, and French.

4207728266,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-alten-belgium-4207728266?position=16&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=wmmsfwYNLY9Vi2AstNOudg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,ALTEN Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","🚀 Job Opening: Data Scientist / Analyst – Dataiku Platform

ALTEN Belgium is a leading technology consulting and engineering company, specializing in Engineering, Life Sciences, and IT services. With a strong presence across various sectors, including automotive, pharmaceuticals, and finance, ALTEN Belgium leverages its expertise to deliver innovative solutions to clients throughout the country. As part of the global ALTEN Group, the company combines local knowledge with international experience to drive technological advancement and support clients in achieving their goals.

At our clients company, data is at the heart of our transformation. Our Enterprise Data & Analytics function is evolving into a Center of Expertise (CoE), delivering advanced analytics, automation, and machine learning solutions.​

We are seeking a Data Scientist / Analyst with robust technical skills to engineer, optimize, and promote our Dataiku (DSS) platform, utilized by both expert and citizen data scientists. This role combines hands-on data science with platform optimization and support responsibilities.​
If you're a problem-solver passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and proficient in tools like Python, Git, Terraform, and AWS, this opportunity is for you.​
Design, build, and automate data workflows and analytics pipelines using Dataiku (DSS).​
Support internal teams and citizen data scientists in effective Dataiku utilization.​
Promote best practices in workflow structure, code quality, and governance.​
Manage and enhance our AWS-hosted Dataiku platform.​
Develop and maintain automation pipelines, integrations, and reusable components.​
Monitor and refine platform usability and performance.​
Collaborate with cloud, infrastructure, MLOps, and data governance teams.​
Assist in deploying ML pipelines into production alongside data science teams.​
Work with support teams to resolve issues and improve user experience.​
Create comprehensive guides, documentation, and tutorials.​
Contribute to the development of an internal knowledge base on analytics and Dataiku usage.
3+ years in data science, analytics, or data platform roles.
Proficient in Python, with working knowledge of Git and Terraform.
Good understanding of AWS infrastructure and cloud deployments.
Comfortable with automation, platform monitoring, and support.
Experience with MLOps, DevOps, or ML pipeline deployment.
Familiarity with platform governance and performance tuning.
Exposure to enterprise data environments and integration work.
Clear communicator across technical and non-technical teams.
Team player with a drive to learn and improve.
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.​
Be part of a transformative journey in data utilization.
Collaborate with top-tier data teams and contribute to scaling a modern data science platform.​
Gain exposure to a diverse ecosystem of tools, projects, and business domains.​
Combine technical expertise with cross-functional impact in a dynamic, inclusive culture.
🔒 Please note: ALTEN Belgium is only considering candidates who do not currently require a work permit and will not require one in the future to work in Belgium.

🚀 Job Opening: Data Scientist / Analyst – Dataiku Platform

📍 Location: Brussels

💼 Seniority: 3–5 years of experience


About ALTEN Belgium

ALTEN Belgium is a leading technology consulting and engineering company, specializing in Engineering, Life Sciences, and IT services. With a strong presence across various sectors, including automotive, pharmaceuticals, and finance, ALTEN Belgium leverages its expertise to deliver innovative solutions to clients throughout the country. As part of the global ALTEN Group, the company combines local knowledge with international experience to drive technological advancement and support clients in achieving their goals.


About the Role

At our clients company, data is at the heart of our transformation. Our Enterprise Data &
column2:
Analytics function is evolving into a Center of Expertise (CoE), delivering advanced analytics, automation, and machine learning solutions.​


We are seeking a Data Scientist / Analyst with robust technical skills to engineer, optimize, and promote our Dataiku (DSS) platform, utilized by both expert and citizen data scientists. This role combines hands-on data science with platform optimization and support responsibilities.​

If you're a problem-solver passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and proficient in tools like Python, Git, Terraform, and AWS, this opportunity is for you.​


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------


🔧 Key Responsibilities

Data Science &
column3:
Platform Enablement

  • Design, build, and automate data workflows and analytics pipelines using Dataiku (DSS).​
  • Support internal teams and citizen data scientists in effective Dataiku utilization.​
  • Promote best practices in workflow structure, code quality, and governance.​

Platform Development &
column4:
Automation

  • Manage and enhance our AWS-hosted Dataiku platform.​
  • Develop and maintain automation pipelines, integrations, and reusable components.​
  • Monitor and refine platform usability and performance.​

Cross-Team Collaboration

  • Collaborate with cloud, infrastructure, MLOps, and data governance teams.​
  • Assist in deploying ML pipelines into production alongside data science teams.​
  • Work with support teams to resolve issues and improve user experience.​

Documentation &
column5:
Knowledge Sharing

  • Create comprehensive guides, documentation, and tutorials.​
  • Contribute to the development of an internal knowledge base on analytics and Dataiku usage.

​

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------


✅Qualifications

Must-Have

  • 3+ years in data science, analytics, or data platform roles.
  • Hands-on experience with Dataiku DSS.
  • Proficient in Python, with working knowledge of Git and Terraform.
  • Good understanding of AWS infrastructure and cloud deployments.
  • Comfortable with automation, platform monitoring, and support.

Nice-to-Have

  • Experience with MLOps, DevOps, or ML pipeline deployment.
  • Familiarity with platform governance and performance tuning.
  • Exposure to enterprise data environments and integration work.

Soft Skills

  • Clear communicator across technical and non-technical teams.
  • Problem-solver with a proactive mindset.
  • Team player with a drive to learn and improve.


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------


🎓 Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.​


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Why Join Us?

  • Be part of a transformative journey in data utilization.
  • Collaborate with top-tier data teams and contribute to scaling a modern data science platform.​
  • Gain exposure to a diverse ecosystem of tools, projects, and business domains.​
  • Combine technical expertise with cross-functional impact in a dynamic, inclusive culture.


🔒 Please note: ALTEN Belgium is only considering candidates who do not currently require a work permit and will not require one in the future to work in Belgium.

4190118008,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-at-dreamland-4190118008?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=UJ4FxOKQxSOgmYaIIPrcpg%3D%3D,Junior Data Analyst,DreamLand,"Beersel, Flemish Region, Belgium","Vacature omschrijving

Om ons datateam te versterken zijn we op zoek naar een gedreven data analyst die een cruciale rol zal spelen in het interpreteren en gebruiken van commerciële en financiële gegevens om inzichten te bieden aan het managementteam.
Opstellen en opvolgen van dashboards om de commerciële prestaties van de organisatie te monitoren, te analyseren en te visualiseren.
Maken van analyses en deep dives zowel proactief als op vraag. Op basis van de noden vanuit de business analyseer je de beschikbare informatie en vertaal je die in adviezen voor het managementteam.
Analyseren van verkoopgegevens, markttrends en klantgedrag om inzicht te krijgen in de prestaties van het assortiment en te komen tot een perfecte productmix.
Identificeren van kansen voor productuitbreiding en vernieuwing op basis van marktanalyse en klantbehoeften
Monitoren van voorraadniveaus en het optimaliseren van de voorraadrotatie.
Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een analytische en/of economische richting. Ook pas afgestudeerden zijn welkom.
Uitstekende kennis van Excel voor analyse en presentatie van gegevens.
Ervaring met opstellen van commerciële dashboards en rapporten is een extra troef.
Ervaring met SAP of vergelijkbare ERP-systemen is een pluspunt.
Sterke analytische vaardigheden en probleemoplossend vermogen.
Hands-on mentaliteit om het terrein te verkennen en sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.
Teamsfeer – Reken op fijne collega’s die je steunen en met wie je samen plezier maakt.
Opleiding – Je wordt opgeleid in je job en daarnaast hebben we een aanbod van opleidingen voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je krijgt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, extra verlofdagen en mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk.

Bij DreamLand kan je anders werken. Jij staat als mens centraal en dat merk je meteen. Zo kan je je vaardigheden scherpstellen dankzij onze ontwikkelingsgerichte aanpak en intern doorgroeien als je dat wilt. Of je nu analist, winkelmedewerker, marketeer of logistiek medewerker bent, bij ons vind je vast een job die perfect bij je past.

Vacature omschrijving

Om ons datateam te versterken zijn we op zoek naar een gedreven data analyst die een cruciale rol zal spelen in het interpreteren en gebruiken van commerciële en financiële gegevens om inzichten te bieden aan het managementteam.

Jouw Verantwoordelijkheden Omvatten Onder Meer

  • Opstellen en opvolgen van dashboards om de commerciële prestaties van de organisatie te monitoren, te analyseren en te visualiseren.
  • Maken van analyses en deep dives zowel proactief als op vraag. Op basis van de noden vanuit de business analyseer je de beschikbare informatie en vertaal je die in adviezen voor het managementteam.
  • Analyseren van verkoopgegevens, markttrends en klantgedrag om inzicht te krijgen in de prestaties van het assortiment en te komen tot een perfecte productmix.
  • Identificeren van kansen voor productuitbreiding en vernieuwing op basis van marktanalyse en klantbehoeften
  • Monitoren van voorraadniveaus en het optimaliseren van de voorraadrotatie.

Profiel

  • Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een analytische en/of economische richting. Ook pas afgestudeerden zijn welkom.
  • Uitstekende kennis van Excel voor analyse en presentatie van gegevens.
  • Ervaring met opstellen van commerciële dashboards en rapporten is een extra troef.
  • Ervaring met SAP of vergelijkbare ERP-systemen is een pluspunt.
  • Sterke analytische vaardigheden en probleemoplossend vermogen.
  • Hands-on mentaliteit om het terrein te verkennen en sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.

Wij bieden

  • Teamsfeer – Reken op fijne collega’s die je steunen en met wie je samen plezier maakt.
  • Opleiding – Je wordt opgeleid in je job en daarnaast hebben we een aanbod van opleidingen voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
  • Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je krijgt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, extra verlofdagen en mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk.

Waarom werken bij DreamLand?

Bij DreamLand kan je anders werken. Jij staat als mens centraal en dat merk je meteen. Zo kan je je vaardigheden scherpstellen dankzij onze ontwikkelingsgerichte aanpak en intern doorgroeien als je dat wilt. Of je nu analist, winkelmedewerker, marketeer of logistiek medewerker bent, bij ons vind je vast een job die perfect bij je past.

4183871626,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-data-consultant-at-capco-4183871626?position=22&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=GjzO%2FuE1JqVlfb%2BqpKoRLg%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Data Consultant,Capco,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Analyst / Data consultant
Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?
Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?
Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.
We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.
In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.
You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.
Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.
We Are Looking For Talent With The Following
Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis
Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English
The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals

An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers

Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients

Data Analyst / Data consultant

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

4121947375,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-sii-group-belgium-4121947375?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=HzJehug33AsdTLyODgznDA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,SII Group Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.
Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis
You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.
A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group
If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.  

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
  • Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
  • Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
  • Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
  • Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis

Qualifications:

  • You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in IT.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
  • Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.

We offer:

  • A challenging and varied role in a growing company
  • Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
  • Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group

If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.
