4142330133,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-intelligence-data-analyst-at-ogilvy-social-lab-belgium-4142330133?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=O7whq%2FjOVRBlgZ3JFd9dJw%3D%3D,Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst,Ogilvy Social.Lab Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About Ogilvy

Ogilvy has been creating impact for brands through iconic, culture-changing, value-driving ideas since the company was founded by David Ogilvy 75 years ago. It builds on that rich legacy through Borderless Creativity – innovating at the intersections of its advertising, public relations, relationship design, consulting, and health capabilities with experts collaborating seamlessly across over 120 offices in nearly 90 countries. Ogilvy currently ranks as the #1 global agency network for creative excellence and effectiveness by WARC, signifying its ability to deliver creative solutions that drive unreasonable impact for clients and communities. Ogilvy is a WPP company (NYSE: WPP). For more information, visit Ogilvy.com, and follow us on LinkedIn, X, Instagram, and Facebook.

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels’ WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices – our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Unilever, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Lidl, Orange, EU and Belgian institutions, fueling their success locally & internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a ""lab” mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

Analyse social and digital data through a set of tools (Social Listening tools like Synthesio, Competitive Analysis tools like RivalIQ, Audience Analysis tools like Profiler or Global Web Index, Trends and Search Analysis tools like Semrush or Social Lab Proprietary Tools, etc.) based on a client briefing. Develop custom approaches leveraging available data sets and technologies to deliver on actionable insights to inform strategic recommendations.
Support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers, communities or creators are ‘saying’, ‘sharing’ and ‘searching’ online.
Design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations.
Deliver high-quality service to local and international clients.
Participate in the creation of new, commercially viable data products.
Work with our clients and present the intelligence work.
Collaborate with WPP and external data providers.
A first experience in Social/Digital/Search Data Analytics, Insights and Digital/Social Strategy
Always-on social listening analysis and insights generation.
Cultural tracking (including trends) and insights generation for always-on and campaign use.
A strong understanding of today’s social media landscape and internet culture (Social 3.0, culture-first, community and creators led, audience-first) and new channels’ codes.
A strong understanding of Social media performance metrics/KPIs for both organic and paid media.
You understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings and turn them into actionable insights
Eye for innovation and the next emerging platform or partner.
Comfortable using social and digital monitoring technologies such as Synthesio, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, etc.
Expert in the understanding of social media and established understanding of the wider digital communication landscape.
Ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team.
Fulltime opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels – the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency – Our words and promises produce actions.
As an Ogilvy Social.Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training and career conversations while doing strong work that works.

At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression.
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose - and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality.

Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve. This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.

Ogilvy is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

If you need any assistance seeking a job opportunity, or if you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at accommodations@ogilvy.com. Please note that this contact is only for candidates who are requesting accommodation. Emails for other purposes, including application status requests, will not receive a response.

4190173326,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/game-data-analyst-at-gameplay-galaxy-4190173326?position=28&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=wgetz4WrFcKZPzSp0j2PNQ%3D%3D,Game Data Analyst,Gameplay Galaxy,European Economic Area,"Department: Data

We are looking for a talented Game Data Analyst to join our dynamic analytics team. You'll work closely with game teams, using data to drive player retention, improve monetization strategies, and optimize user experience. If you’re excited by data and games, this is the role for you.
All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With
You’ll collaborate with game development teams to analyze player behavior, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to drive game performance and player engagement.
You’ll create dashboards and visualizations that support key business decisions by presenting clear and data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
You’ll design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new game features and mechanics.
You’ll work on projects related to the blockchain, analyzing how players engage with decentralized features and in-game economies.
You’ll contribute to advanced analytics projects, including game economy analysis, to enhance monetization strategies and game progression.
You’ll build out new ways to map in-game events, such as stunts, crashes, and progression to optimize player experience.
You’ll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.
What You'll Bring To The Team
At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.
Why You'll Love Working With Us
We’re 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!

We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You’ll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You’ll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We are looking for a talented Game Data Analyst to join our dynamic analytics team. You'll work closely with game teams, using data to drive player retention, improve monetization strategies, and optimize user experience. If you’re excited by data and games, this is the role for you.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With

  • You’ll collaborate with game development teams to analyze player behavior, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to drive game performance and player engagement.
  • You’ll create dashboards and visualizations that support key business decisions by presenting clear and data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
  • You’ll design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new game features and mechanics.
  • You’ll work on projects related to the blockchain, analyzing how players engage with decentralized features and in-game economies.
  • You’ll contribute to advanced analytics projects, including game economy analysis, to enhance monetization strategies and game progression.
  • You’ll build out new ways to map in-game events, such as stunts, crashes, and progression to optimize player experience.
  • You’ll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.

What You'll Bring To The Team

  • At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
  • Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
  • Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
  • Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
  • Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
  • A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
  • A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.

Why You'll Love Working With Us

  • We’re 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
  • We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
  • You’ll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
  • You’ll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
  • We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
  • We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
  • We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

4165278033,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analytics-lead-at-semetis-4165278033?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=5QK%2BF39cf9WxaR5T13fL4A%3D%3D,Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead,Semetis,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"📄 Type: Full-time | 📊 Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)

At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.
Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.
4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn’t be offered.

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data—we turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium’s leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.

This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn’t just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.
If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.
Full job description & application details here.
Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.

📄 Type: Full-time | 📊 Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)


At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence &
column2:
Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.


Your Mission:

  • Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
  • Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
  • Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
  • Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
  • Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.


What You Bring:

  • 4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
  • Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
  • Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
  • Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
  • Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
  • Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn’t be offered.


Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data—we turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium’s leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.


This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn’t just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.


If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.


Full job description &
column3:
application details here.


Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.

4195458275,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-lending-data-analyst-at-ing-belgium-4195458275?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=YEJNDNEb18ZQoe598whQsw%3D%3D,Business Lending Data Analyst,ING Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Your role & work environment
As part of the development towards a “More Digital- and Data driven Bank”, ING is renewing the data management capabilities globally.

As a data analyst in Business Lending, you work on a daily basis with (cross-border) colleagues having different expertise in self-steering feature teams (squads), contributing to the objectives of the tribe Business Lending which are supporting the business overall. These objectives are challenging, as regulatory and risk requirements are strengthening, client expectations are changing and there is a continuous pressure to increase efficiency. Within this context, you contribute to the design of an efficient and customer-oriented value proposition thanks to an extensive use of data analytics, but also including products and services, harmonized when possible between Belgium and the Netherlands. You will cover several customer segments from self-employed to mid-corporates.

Develop and automate Management Information reports (1) enabling the senior leaders to make appropriate decisions or (2) helping the bank to follow-up it’s compliancy against regulations or internal policies.
Translating the bank and tribe strategy to concrete initiatives within the scope of your squad
Analyzing the feasibility and the value of opportunities
Evaluating our way of working with the aim to continuously improve
Liaise with Customer Journey Experts to ensure reporting & data quality requirements are covered as from the design of the process.
Actively participating and taking initiative to improve the collaboration between different stakeholders and colleagues in other teams
Understanding and applying business principles and ensure compliancy with external regulation and internal minimum requirements

A colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a knack for always being a step ahead. In other words, you strive to bring fresh ideas to life and embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment. You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals. You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to propose creative solutions to problems.
As a Business Lending Data Analyst you will also need:
To be customer driven and focused, loving to collaborate with different people, ready to explore
An entrepreneurial attitude – taking initiative and making things happen, manage and solve problems with the support of senior colleague
To act as process owner in the business lending domain with the support of a more senior colleague
To be interested in innovation in the domain, experiment by challenging existing trends, be curious
To manage projects involving one or 2 stakeholders with the support of a more senior colleague
affinity with data and good analytical skills, previous experience with data management/analysis
Knowledge of reporting software such as SAS Enteprise Guide, SAS Visual Analyics, PowerBI, Cognos, …
Planning & organizational skills and ability to develop them with coaching
Clear communication skills : written and oral, be able to adapt your speech to the audience with the help of a more senior colleague
Previous experience in a (credit) risk oriented role is a plus
Knowledge of business lending products/services is recommended
Fluent in English and Dutch or French
Master degree or Bachelor degree with relevant work experience (e.g. Business Analyst, Data Analyst, .. )

4197243513,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-fsma-4197243513?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=YPZKXpxXDqB%2Fqigm6QRqYQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,FSMA,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?
Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‘Data analytics expertise centre’

The ‘Data analytics expertise centre’ occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.
You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.
WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?
A Master’s degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2: a doctorate is an asset.

column1: Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.
A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.

A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.
Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?


Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‘Data analytics expertise centre’


WHERE WILL YOU BE WORKING?


The ‘Data analytics expertise centre’ occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.


WHAT WILL YOUR JOB ENTAIL?


  • You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
  • You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
  • You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
  • You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.


WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?


  • A Master’s degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2:
a doctorate is an asset.
  • Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
  • Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
  • Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
  • An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
  • Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
  • Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
  • Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
  • Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
  • Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.


    • WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?


    • A full-time job with a permanent contract.
    • The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
    • A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
    • A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
    • Flexible working hours.
    • Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
    • Opportunities for internal mobility.
    • Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.


    Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

4152730331,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-cream-consulting-4152730331?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=DE2HK1sTx29SuK8MLaEtAw%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Cream Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Permanent position only

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).
Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs

Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?
You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English
column2: a good knowledge of Dutch is also required

column1: You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request
An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset
WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?
A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!
THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,
CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY""

4200129785,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/commercial-data-analyst-at-luminus-4200129785?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=PXjYoVCyrDqGWbW07TcBog%3D%3D,Commercial Data Analyst,Luminus,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Publication date: April 3, 2025

Become a key part of our Data Analysis team in the Retail & B2B department and help shape Luminus' vision with data-driven insights. Your skills in SQL, SAS, and Qlik will be essential for analyzing large datasets to reveal trends and patterns that enhance retail operations and improve the customer experience.
You develop and maintain advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
You generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
You maintain close relationships with business stakeholders and acquire detailed knowledge of business processes.
You collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
You respond to ad-hoc data requests and support day-to-day operations with timely data analysis.
You drive continuous improvement in retail processes through proactive data insights and innovations.
You present data-driven recommendations to management and aid in the decision-making process.
You hold an MSc degree in a business, data, or technology-related field, or have equivalent experience.
You have expert knowledge of SQL. You are highly skilled in data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R.
You also have knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik.
You have a strong analytical mindset with a keen attention to detail.
You are agile and results-focused, with a work ethic that drives success.
You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
You possess excellent communication skills in English and are proficient in Dutch or French.
Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

Publication date: April 3, 2025

Brussels

Contract open-end

Become a key part of our Data Analysis team in the Retail &
column2:
B2B department and help shape Luminus' vision with data-driven insights. Your skills in SQL, SAS, and Qlik will be essential for analyzing large datasets to reveal trends and patterns that enhance retail operations and improve the customer experience.

Your Daily Job

  • You develop and maintain advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
  • You generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
  • You maintain close relationships with business stakeholders and acquire detailed knowledge of business processes.
  • You collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
  • You respond to ad-hoc data requests and support day-to-day operations with timely data analysis.
  • You drive continuous improvement in retail processes through proactive data insights and innovations.
  • You present data-driven recommendations to management and aid in the decision-making process.

Your Profile

  • You hold an MSc degree in a business, data, or technology-related field, or have equivalent experience.
  • You have expert knowledge of SQL. You are highly skilled in data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R.
  • You also have knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik.
  • You have a strong analytical mindset with a keen attention to detail.
  • You are agile and results-focused, with a work ethic that drives success.
  • You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
  • You possess excellent communication skills in English and are proficient in Dutch or French.

Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 9l5.93-4L15 6.54l-6.15 4.2a1.5 1.5 0 01-1.69 0L1 6.54 2.07 5z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

En tant que Data Analyst/Steward, tu fais partie du bureau I-ICT.232 Business Support Solutions. Ce bureau gère des projets transversaux et met à disposition des solutions numériques pour les différents départements d'Infrabel, comme le développement d'applications, de plateformes et de portails.
Pour ce poste, tu seras souvent en contact avec le département Customer & Business Excellence (I-CBE), où toutes les tâches opérationnelles et liées aux clients de notre entreprise sont gérées.
La collaboration entre I-ICT.232 et I-CBE garantit que les solutions numériques et les architectures développées répondent parfaitement aux besoins opérationnels et liés aux clients d'Infrabel.

Nous recherchons un Data Analyst/Steward qui accumule des connaissances sur les données de la direction I-CBE. Tu décriras les données, les expliqueras et réaliseras toi-même des analyses afin de générer des résultats à valeur ajoutée.
Décrire et présenter les données de manière compréhensible et exploitable.

Collecter et structurer des données brutes provenant de sources diverses, en tenant compte de la méthodologie et des normes établies par Infrabel, afin d'obtenir un extrait logique des données utiles et de créer la base d'analyses ultérieures.
Vérifier la qualité des données, détecter d'éventuelles irrégularités et discuter des erreurs avec le propriétaire des données afin de pouvoir effectuer des analyses sur des données de haute qualité.
Examiner et cartographier les différentes relations, liens et tendances existants dans les données afin d'obtenir une réponse à une demande précise.
Vérifier l'importance et la fiabilité des relations et des liens trouvés afin d'obtenir un résultat qui reflète la réalité.
Développer des modèles de données innovants basés sur les relations significatives trouvées afin d'optimiser les méthodes d'analyse existantes.
Établir des rapports, des tableaux de bord et des visualisations pour mettre en évidence les informations trouvées.
Fournir des interprétations des résultats obtenus afin de garantir l'exactitude des conclusions et de faciliter la prise de décisions associées .
Documenter les données dans le catalogue de données afin de garantir la disponibilité, l'utilisabilité et la centralisation des données.
Servir de point de contact pour toutes les questions concernant les données et partager les connaissances sur ces données au sein de I-ICT et de I-CBE.
Tu as un niveau master ou équivalent par expérience.
Expérience démontrable en données (au moins 3 ans) dans un poste similaire au sein du secteur ICT.
Excellentes compétences analytiques et travail précis et orienté vers les procédures.
Capacité à travailler de manière autonome dans des cadres convenus et être également un bon team player.
Communiquer de manière claire et structurée, adaptée à l'interlocuteur.
Penser de manière innovante et hors des sentiers battus.
Apprendre continuellement et suivre les évolutions technologiques.
Résistant au stress et capable de définir les bonnes priorités.
Connaissance des plateformes IT telles que les serveurs, les bases de données, les middleware et le cloud.
Connaissance statistique des algorithmes et des modèles mathématiques.
Connaissance de base du fonctionnement des technologies de données concernées.
Expérience avec la méthodologie de modélisation et la modélisation de processus (ERD/UML & BPMN).
Connaissance du fonctionnement d'Infrabel et de la SNCB est un plus.
S’exprimer couramment en français ou néerlandais, avec une bonne connaissance de l'autre langue nationale ou volonté de l'améliorer. Bonne connaissance de l'anglais technique.
Nous considérons la diversité comme une vraie richesse. Pour travailler chez nous, seuls le talent et l’enthousiasme entrent en ligne de compte.
Dans une entreprise stable qui contribue à une mobilité durable en phase avec la société
De nombreuses possibilités de formation et de carrière : tu es entrepreneur.neuse de ta propre carrière
Une grande flexibilité, pour un équilibre entre travail et vie privée
Un package salarial attrayant avec divers avantages supplémentaires

Infrabel construit, entretient et renouvelle l’infrastructure ferroviaire en Belgique. Ensemble avec nos 10 000 collègues, nous voulons innover et créer de l'impact avec bienveillance, fiabilité, positivité et courage. Ces valeurs fondamentales sont la base de notre culture d'entreprise et guident tout ce que nous faisons. En misant sur les datas, la digitalisation et des partenariats solides, nous construisons une mobilité durable et sûre, maintenant et pour le futur.
Curieux.se d'en savoir plus ? Clique ici pour plus d'infos.

Chez Infrabel, nous sommes fier.e.s de notre certification Top Employer ! Car elle récompense nos nombreux projets en lien avec la sécurité et le bien-être de nos collègues, ou encore, notre ambitieuse politique de diversité et d'inclusion. Le télétravail, le développement personnel, l'ergonomie, la motivation du personnel, et la gestion du stress, ne sont que quelques exemples de thématiques sur lesquelles nous travaillons chaque jour.

DES QUESTIONS SUR CETTE OFFRE D'EMPLOI?
Laura-Maria Mahr, Talent Acquisition Specialist | E-mail: lauramaria.mahr@infrabel.be

N’oublie pas de créer un profil via ‘Mon profil’. Tu peux non seulement ajouter tes données, mais également créer des « alertes d’emploi » en fonction de tes intérêts. De cette façon, tu seras le/la premier.ère à recevoir les nouvelles offre d’emploi qui te conviennent dans ta boîte mail.

LE TRAVAIL

Pour ce poste, tu seras souvent en contact avec le département Customer &

TON PROFIL

  • Connaissance de base du fonctionnement des technologies de données concernées.

BPMN).

4204360822,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/clinical-data-analyst-at-intuition-it-%E2%80%93-intuitive-technology-recruitment-4204360822?position=47&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=5ryE2wSUpSRPux2uK7Poqw%3D%3D,Clinical Data Analyst,Intuition IT – Intuitive Technology Recruitment,European Union,"Title: Clinical Data Management
Must have good experience in Veeva CDM.
• Performs data review of clinical trial data, including query management. Communicates with study team members and CRO (Contract Research Organization) to resolve queries.
• Performs detailed review of eCOA/external data per the Date Review Plan and works closely with the vendor and CRO to resolve eCOA/external data related issues. May include the following:
• Acts as liaison between Customer, CRO and eCOA vendor/external data vendor.
• Ensures accessibility of eCOA/external data to all relevant Customer and CRO team.
• QCs a sample of data clarification requests processed by the eCOA/external data vendor.
• Maintains eCOA/external data issues within the centralized study data issues log.
• Ensures appropriate and timely communication of eCOA/external data related issues and resolutions to relevant Customer and CRO team.
• Performs reconciliation review of eCOA/external data against EDC data and works with applicable parties to resolve queries.
• Performs SAE (Serious Adverse Event) reconciliation and communicates with applicable safety team members to resolve issues.
• May prepare and distribute performance metrics (e.g. site completion of data entry and resolution of queries) to applicable stakeholders. Escalates to CDM Lead and study team as needed.

• Contributes to the creation and maintenance of study data cleaning plan components, including edit checks (data validation plan), listing review checks, data integration specifications, data transfer specifications, external data reconciliation plan(s), coding guidelines, SAE reconciliation guidelines, database lock plans.
• Performs additional review activities for interim and final database locks as needed.
• Files study documentation in electronic Trial Master File (eTMF) and department project files.
• Performs periodic quality review of eTMF documents.
• Assists with taking meeting minutes and documenting/tracking study data management activities.
• Performs inspection readiness activities and supports CDM team during internal and regulatory inspections

• Supports the set-up and testing of study data collection tools such as EDC (electronic data capture), IRT (interactive response technology), eCOA (electronic clinical outcome assessment), ePRO (electronic patient reported outcomes), and creation/maintenance of associated documentation.
• May contribute to the creation and maintenance of study eCRF Completion Guidelines and other data collection tool guidelines.
• May assist with management of account access and training materials for data collection tools
• Assists with quality review of above activities performed by the CRO, as needed.
• Coordinates and oversees the work of other data coordinators.
• Ensure compliance with own Learning Curricula, corporate and/or GXP requirements.

Title: Clinical Data Management

Location: Anywhere in Europe

Type: Contract

Notice period: Immediate – 2 weeks

Must have good experience in Veeva CDM.


Job Description:


Data Review

• Performs data review of clinical trial data, including query management. Communicates with study team members and CRO (Contract Research Organization) to resolve queries.

• Performs detailed review of eCOA/external data per the Date Review Plan and works closely with the vendor and CRO to resolve eCOA/external data related issues. May include the following:

• Acts as liaison between Customer, CRO and eCOA vendor/external data vendor.

• Ensures accessibility of eCOA/external data to all relevant Customer and CRO team.

• QCs a sample of data clarification requests processed by the eCOA/external data vendor.

• Maintains eCOA/external data issues within the centralized study data issues log.

• Ensures appropriate and timely communication of eCOA/external data related issues and resolutions to relevant Customer and CRO team.

• Performs reconciliation review of eCOA/external data against EDC data and works with applicable parties to resolve queries.

• Performs SAE (Serious Adverse Event) reconciliation and communicates with applicable safety team members to resolve issues.

• May prepare and distribute performance metrics (e.g. site completion of data entry and resolution of queries) to applicable stakeholders. Escalates to CDM Lead and study team as needed.

• Contributes to the creation and maintenance of study data cleaning plan components, including edit checks (data validation plan), listing review checks, data integration specifications, data transfer specifications, external data reconciliation plan(s), coding guidelines, SAE reconciliation guidelines, database lock plans.

• Performs additional review activities for interim and final database locks as needed.


Documentation &
column2:
Filing

• Files study documentation in electronic Trial Master File (eTMF) and department project files.

• Performs periodic quality review of eTMF documents.

• Assists with taking meeting minutes and documenting/tracking study data management activities.

• Performs data archival activities.

• Performs inspection readiness activities and supports CDM team during internal and regulatory inspections


Data Collection Systems

• Supports the set-up and testing of study data collection tools such as EDC (electronic data capture), IRT (interactive response technology), eCOA (electronic clinical outcome assessment), ePRO (electronic patient reported outcomes), and creation/maintenance of associated documentation.

• May contribute to the creation and maintenance of study eCRF Completion Guidelines and other data collection tool guidelines.

• May assist with management of account access and training materials for data collection tools


Additional Activities

• Assists with quality review of above activities performed by the CRO, as needed.

• Coordinates and oversees the work of other data coordinators.

• Mentors other data coordinators.

• Ensure compliance with own Learning Curricula, corporate and/or GXP requirements.

4201260357,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analyste-de-donn%C3%A9es-at-sii-group-belgium-4201260357?position=51&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=DswhwnMJVoRD23xVHmlI8A%3D%3D,Analyste de données,SII Group Belgium,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.
Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis
You hold a master’s degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.
A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group
If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium. Let's Tech Together!

SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.


SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
  • Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
  • Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
  • Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
  • Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis


Qualifications:

  • You hold a master’s degree in IT.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
  • Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.


We offer:

  • A challenging and varied role in a growing company
  • Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
  • Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group


If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium. Let's Tech Together!

4202747264,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/impact-analyzer-at-nissan-motor-corporation-4202747264?position=52&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=itP6Xwi4jopAr5czUWOjUQ%3D%3D,Impact Analyzer,Nissan Motor Corporation,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of ""Defy Ordinary"".
We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.
How you can contribute and have an impact?
Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.
Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.

Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
Our future vision and ambition is ""Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond"" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of ""Defy Ordinary"".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics &
column2: Innovation team and report to the Analytics &amp
column3:
Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?

  • Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
  • Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
  • Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
  • Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
  • Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
  • Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
  • Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
  • Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.

What we look for:

  • Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
  • Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
  • Business viability mindset.
  • New business model experience
  • Customer journey understanding.
  • Lifecycle management.
  • New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
  • Workshop animation.
  • Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
  • Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
  • Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.

Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is ""Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond"" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

4142276479,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-bi-engineer-data-analyst-%C2%A0-september-2025-at-capgemini-4142276479?position=56&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=HfbhyKGjA%2BRyGvoCG8DATA%3D%3D,Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst -  September 2025,Capgemini,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.
At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!
As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:
Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.
We Are Looking For Someone Who
Owns a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.
Success In This Role Often Comes Down To
Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.
We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here’s what you can expect:
A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.
We'd love to hear from you if you’re passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.
Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

4077263986,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-senior-h-f-at-extia-4077263986?position=57&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=zDRdCpJiS7yJp08dEJBx1w%3D%3D,Data Analyst Senior (H/F),Extia,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !
Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.
Vous serez notamment en charge de :
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises
Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :
Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,

Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.
Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération
Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

  • Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
  • Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
  • Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas &
column2:
Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !
