4178648730,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-data-analytics-academic-year-2025-2026-at-deloitte-4178648730?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=CY86bROPz%2Ft1j3sGluE2Gw%3D%3D&trackingId=ywWSug2M%2FbpqAsItvBDilQ%3D%3D,Internship Data & Analytics - Academic Year 2025-2026,Deloitte,"Zaventem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Join us and you’ll be immersed in a dynamic company where you’ll work with a diverse group of talented colleagues on a variety of exciting projects.

You’ll be inspired and learn every day, exploring many different industries and collaborating with our clients, ranging from large national to multinational companies to non-profit and public sector organisations.
This is the field of interest for you, if you want to conduct in-depth analyses of business and technology issues, but also make recommendations to improve or transform our clients' businesses.
Depending on the team you join, you will have different kinds of tasks:
You'll work on interesting and challenging assignments that inspire you daily with their diversity
You’ll assist in analysing data, helping our clients to unlock their data solutions and to drive analytical needs
You’ll put your analytical skills into practice, improving your strong analytical mind.
You’ll capture and translate requirements from the business as well as new existing environments.
You’ll extract, collect, and organise data to find correlations and patterns that produce meaningful conclusions relevant to businesses.
You’ll work with different kinds of software, data tools, and ERP systems.
You'll structure and leverage our clients’ data to improve their businesses.
The list above is a general overview. You'll receive more information during the interviews.
You are in the final year of your bachelor or master’s degree or your pre-final master year.
You are highly motivated, and a reliable team player with a sense of initiative.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and have a good knowledge of English.
You have a critical mindset and good analytical skills.
You have the ability to conceptualise and articulate ideas and solutions.
You are able to use MS Office tools (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).
You are rigorous in your daily routine, but also in your working tools and methods.

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities
Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.
Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

Join us and you’ll be immersed in a dynamic company where you’ll work with a diverse group of talented colleagues on a variety of exciting projects.

You’ll be inspired and learn every day, exploring many different industries and collaborating with our clients, ranging from large national to multinational companies to non-profit and public sector organisations.

This is the field of interest for you, if you want to conduct in-depth analyses of business and technology issues, but also make recommendations to improve or transform our clients' businesses.

Depending on the team you join, you will have different kinds of tasks:

  • You'll work on interesting and challenging assignments that inspire you daily with their diversity
  • You’ll assist in analysing data, helping our clients to unlock their data solutions and to drive analytical needs
  • You’ll put your analytical skills into practice, improving your strong analytical mind.
  • You’ll capture and translate requirements from the business as well as new existing environments.
  • You’ll extract, collect, and organise data to find correlations and patterns that produce meaningful conclusions relevant to businesses.
  • You’ll work with different kinds of software, data tools, and ERP systems.
  • You'll structure and leverage our clients’ data to improve their businesses.

The list above is a general overview. You'll receive more information during the interviews.

Let’s Talk About You

  • You are in the final year of your bachelor or master’s degree or your pre-final master year.
  • You are highly motivated, and a reliable team player with a sense of initiative.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and have a good knowledge of English.
  • You have a critical mindset and good analytical skills.
  • You have the ability to conceptualise and articulate ideas and solutions.
  • You are results oriented.
  • You are able to use MS Office tools (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).
  • You work methodically and conscientiously.
  • You are rigorous in your daily routine, but also in your working tools and methods.

Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

  • Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
  • Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
  • Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
  • Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:

  • Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
  • Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

4023511495,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-m-f-at-littlebigcode-4023511495?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=ohIhJfn6V9eYy994yNMSTQ%3D%3D&trackingId=fcInQZfsqXTF6BjGB%2FmDIA%3D%3D,Data Analyst M/F,LittleBigCode,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.
A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up
As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !
What will be your tasks with us ?
You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:
Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations
You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.

4195458275,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-lending-data-analyst-at-ing-belgium-4195458275?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=ohIhJfn6V9eYy994yNMSTQ%3D%3D&trackingId=h6Fr%2BcpuCFCYjBheXBlw2g%3D%3D,Business Lending Data Analyst,ING Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Your role & work environment
As part of the development towards a “More Digital- and Data driven Bank”, ING is renewing the data management capabilities globally.

As a data analyst in Business Lending, you work on a daily basis with (cross-border) colleagues having different expertise in self-steering feature teams (squads), contributing to the objectives of the tribe Business Lending which are supporting the business overall. These objectives are challenging, as regulatory and risk requirements are strengthening, client expectations are changing and there is a continuous pressure to increase efficiency. Within this context, you contribute to the design of an efficient and customer-oriented value proposition thanks to an extensive use of data analytics, but also including products and services, harmonized when possible between Belgium and the Netherlands. You will cover several customer segments from self-employed to mid-corporates.

Develop and automate Management Information reports (1) enabling the senior leaders to make appropriate decisions or (2) helping the bank to follow-up it’s compliancy against regulations or internal policies.
Translating the bank and tribe strategy to concrete initiatives within the scope of your squad
Analyzing the feasibility and the value of opportunities
Evaluating our way of working with the aim to continuously improve
Liaise with Customer Journey Experts to ensure reporting & data quality requirements are covered as from the design of the process.
Actively participating and taking initiative to improve the collaboration between different stakeholders and colleagues in other teams
Understanding and applying business principles and ensure compliancy with external regulation and internal minimum requirements

A colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a knack for always being a step ahead. In other words, you strive to bring fresh ideas to life and embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment. You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals. You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to propose creative solutions to problems.
As a Business Lending Data Analyst you will also need:
To be customer driven and focused, loving to collaborate with different people, ready to explore
An entrepreneurial attitude – taking initiative and making things happen, manage and solve problems with the support of senior colleague
To act as process owner in the business lending domain with the support of a more senior colleague
To be interested in innovation in the domain, experiment by challenging existing trends, be curious
To manage projects involving one or 2 stakeholders with the support of a more senior colleague
affinity with data and good analytical skills, previous experience with data management/analysis
Knowledge of reporting software such as SAS Enteprise Guide, SAS Visual Analyics, PowerBI, Cognos, …
Planning & organizational skills and ability to develop them with coaching
Clear communication skills : written and oral, be able to adapt your speech to the audience with the help of a more senior colleague
Previous experience in a (credit) risk oriented role is a plus
Knowledge of business lending products/services is recommended
Fluent in English and Dutch or French
Master degree or Bachelor degree with relevant work experience (e.g. Business Analyst, Data Analyst, .. )

4121947375,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-sii-group-belgium-4121947375?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=ohIhJfn6V9eYy994yNMSTQ%3D%3D&trackingId=%2F9yz9JUfml30MOhCWdQrZg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,SII Group Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.
Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis
You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.
A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group
If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.  

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
  • Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
  • Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
  • Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
  • Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis

Qualifications:

  • You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in IT.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
  • Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.

We offer:

  • A challenging and varied role in a growing company
  • Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
  • Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group

If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

4197243513,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-fsma-4197243513?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=ohIhJfn6V9eYy994yNMSTQ%3D%3D&trackingId=QxL0lzI57r7RVPTuL%2BLWAA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,FSMA,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?
Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‘Data analytics expertise centre’

The ‘Data analytics expertise centre’ occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.
You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.
WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?
A Master’s degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2: a doctorate is an asset.

column1: Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.
A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.

A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.
Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?


Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‘Data analytics expertise centre’


WHERE WILL YOU BE WORKING?


The ‘Data analytics expertise centre’ occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.


WHAT WILL YOUR JOB ENTAIL?


  • You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
  • You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
  • You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
  • You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.


WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?


  • A Master’s degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2:
a doctorate is an asset.
  • Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
  • Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
  • Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
  • An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
  • Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
  • Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
  • Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
  • Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
  • Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.


    • WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?


    • A full-time job with a permanent contract.
    • The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
    • A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
    • A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
    • Flexible working hours.
    • Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
    • Opportunities for internal mobility.
    • Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.


    Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

4200129785,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/commercial-data-analyst-at-luminus-4200129785?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=ohIhJfn6V9eYy994yNMSTQ%3D%3D&trackingId=QhBLTLlohkBUjWl6WX0tJA%3D%3D,Commercial Data Analyst,Luminus,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Publication date: April 3, 2025

Become a key part of our Data Analysis team in the Retail & B2B department and help shape Luminus' vision with data-driven insights. Your skills in SQL, SAS, and Qlik will be essential for analyzing large datasets to reveal trends and patterns that enhance retail operations and improve the customer experience.
You develop and maintain advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
You generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
You maintain close relationships with business stakeholders and acquire detailed knowledge of business processes.
You collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
You respond to ad-hoc data requests and support day-to-day operations with timely data analysis.
You drive continuous improvement in retail processes through proactive data insights and innovations.
You present data-driven recommendations to management and aid in the decision-making process.
You hold an MSc degree in a business, data, or technology-related field, or have equivalent experience.
You have expert knowledge of SQL. You are highly skilled in data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R.
You also have knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik.
You have a strong analytical mindset with a keen attention to detail.
You are agile and results-focused, with a work ethic that drives success.
You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
You possess excellent communication skills in English and are proficient in Dutch or French.
Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

Publication date: April 3, 2025

Brussels

Contract open-end

Become a key part of our Data Analysis team in the Retail &
column2:
B2B department and help shape Luminus' vision with data-driven insights. Your skills in SQL, SAS, and Qlik will be essential for analyzing large datasets to reveal trends and patterns that enhance retail operations and improve the customer experience.

Your Daily Job

  • You develop and maintain advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
  • You generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
  • You maintain close relationships with business stakeholders and acquire detailed knowledge of business processes.
  • You collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
  • You respond to ad-hoc data requests and support day-to-day operations with timely data analysis.
  • You drive continuous improvement in retail processes through proactive data insights and innovations.
  • You present data-driven recommendations to management and aid in the decision-making process.

Your Profile

  • You hold an MSc degree in a business, data, or technology-related field, or have equivalent experience.
  • You have expert knowledge of SQL. You are highly skilled in data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R.
  • You also have knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik.
  • You have a strong analytical mindset with a keen attention to detail.
  • You are agile and results-focused, with a work ethic that drives success.
  • You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
  • You possess excellent communication skills in English and are proficient in Dutch or French.

Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

4205237730,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-h-f-at-extia-4205237730?position=1&pageNum=5&refId=QmpuWh4%2FAUx4ikPQwqlAdg%3D%3D&trackingId=cf%2BFgacQupv3eiIHwHlKtA%3D%3D,Data Analyst (H/F),Extia,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez, Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN, Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions. Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.
Vous serez notamment en charge de :
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises
Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :
Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,

Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.
Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

4188837931,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-consultant-analyst-project-manager-financial-services-at-square-management-belgium-4188837931?position=6&pageNum=5&refId=QmpuWh4%2FAUx4ikPQwqlAdg%3D%3D&trackingId=QRhOgqx6ZpAN1dqET2UmFQ%3D%3D,Data Consultant (Analyst & Project Manager) - Financial Services,Square Management Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Consultant (Analyst & Project Manager) - Financial Services (min 1 year of experience)

Square Management Belgium est à la recherche de consultants expérimentés (minimum 1 an) possédant une expérience significative et un intérêt dans le domaine de la data dans le secteur financier (banque et assurance).
Cabinet de référence dans le secteur financier, nous accompagnons nos clients dans leurs projets de transformation grâce à l’expertise de nos 100 consultants.
Square Management Belgium fait partie du groupe Square Management, un cabinet de conseil européen en stratégie et organisation fondé en 2008, présent en France, en Belgique et au Luxembourg.
💡 Qu’attendons-nous de vous dans notre domaine d’expertise Data ?
Identifier et hiérarchiser les actifs de données critiques
Élaborer et maintenir des procédures et des politiques de planification, de surveillance et de contrôle des données
Prendre des décisions basées sur les données grâce à des analyses, des visualisations, des quality checks et des data sets
Structurer et exploiter les données de nos clients pour améliorer et renforcer leur activité
Formuler des recommandations et des conclusions

En interne, vous serez impliqué dans la production de contenus d’expertise (articles, publications, podcasts, …), ainsi que dans la participation aux réponses aux appels d’offres et aux initiatives autour de votre communauté.
🔝 Êtes-vous la personne idéale pour ce poste ?
Vous êtes titulaire d'un Master d'une école de commerce, d'une école d'ingénieur ou d'une université
Vous disposez d'au minimum 1 an d'expérience dans un cabinet de conseil, un environnement projet ou dans les services financiers (banque/assurance)
Vous parlez français ou néerlandais (langue maternelle) et parlez couramment l'anglais
Vous possédez des connaissances et des compétences en data analyse et data management
Des expériences en tant que chef de projet, Business/ Functional Analyst et Process Analyst sont un atout majeur.
Vous êtes orientés client, vous comprenez les besoins et les attentes des parties prenantes
Rigoureux dans l'atteinte de vos objectifs, vous possédez de bonnes capacités d'analyse et de communication orale et écrite
Vous êtes proactif, impliqué et vous adaptez rapidement aux nouvelles situations
🎁 Qu’est-ce que Square Management Belgium peut vous offrir ?
Un parcours professionnel en adéquation avec vos ambitions et votre expérience. Vos responsabilités varient selon votre grade (de consultant confirmé à Principal)
Un parcours de formations articulé autour de nos domaines d'excellence : plus de 150 formations certifiantes (méthodologie, métier, langues, développement personnel)

Une excellente opportunité d’évolution personnelle et professionnelle : des missions enrichissantes pour des clients majeurs dans de multiples secteurs (finance, assurance, banque, secteur public, énergie, etc.)
column2: partager vos connaissances avec vos collègues et impliquez-vous dans un rôle interne qui encourage l'intrapreneuriat et l'intelligence collective autour de la production de contenus (articles, publications, podcast)

4210904749,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-m-w-d-at-everience-germany-gmbh-4210904749?position=10&pageNum=5&refId=QmpuWh4%2FAUx4ikPQwqlAdg%3D%3D&trackingId=S9dRpg%2F9BhT7KHFIGZ3dHg%3D%3D,Data Engineer (m/w/d),everience Germany GmbH,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Company Description
Our mission at Everience is to unleash the potential of digital technology to enable companies to focus on their value chain and increase their productivity and competitiveness.

We provide a tailor-made response to the needs of our customers to help them build an efficient working environment, adapted to the needs of users by deploying a wide range of expertise: consulting, desktop engineering, user support, knowledge management, business support, cybersecurity, cloud and infrastructure management, smart office, IT logistics
Everience operates in the Benelux and internationally and has 16 sites in Europe.
The quality of our services and the excellence of the technical expertise of our employees is our priority Everience is recruiting...
End-to-end coordination for the Epic delivery on time, on budget, and on scope.
Act as a single point of contact for the Epic in and outside the Tribe/division.
Ensure that Epic delivery is following the System Delivery Life Cycle (SDLC – requirements/design/test/launch lifecycle) and is compliant with the associated IT controls.
Define the Cost (assessing the uncertainty level and add a contingency effort, etc ...) in the Epic investment Request.
Manage the budget and support the Epic Business Owner on Epic Benefits delivery.
Assess and manage the risks associated with the Epic delivery.
Represent and report out on the Epic throughout the entire lifecycle in steering committees. From ideation until closure.
Project manager skills, ensuring an initiative is managed within the defined and agreed boundaries (Time, Scope, and budget).
Experience in working in an Agile context, comfortable to apply Agile practice. Agile certification is a plus.
Solid understanding of the IT systems technology stack (from hardware to offering cloud services) and experience in a complex multi-tenant technical environment.
Knowledge of the specific tools is an asset: Azure DevOps Boards, ServiceNow (project, risk, resource management modules).
Stakeholder management. Ability to build a strong stakeholder relationship considering they might be in various countries all over the world (remote management).
Professional Project Manager certifications are an asset.
Knowledge of ITIL is an asset.
All our positions are open to people with disabilities

Everience operates in the Benelux and internationally and has 16 sites in Europe.

Qualifications

  • Project manager skills, ensuring an initiative is managed within the defined and agreed boundaries (Time, Scope, and budget).
  • Experience in working in an Agile context, comfortable to apply Agile practice. Agile certification is a plus.
  • Solid understanding of the IT systems technology stack (from hardware to offering cloud services) and experience in a complex multi-tenant technical environment.
  • Knowledge of the specific tools is an asset: Azure DevOps Boards, ServiceNow (project, risk, resource management modules).
  • Stakeholder management. Ability to build a strong stakeholder relationship considering they might be in various countries all over the world (remote management).
  • Professional Project Manager certifications are an asset.
  • Knowledge of ITIL is an asset.

Additional Information

All our positions are open to people with disabilities

4203259846,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-mavie-4203259846?position=1&pageNum=7&refId=lYBQMcSYmkMees2ehu5qAg%3D%3D&trackingId=E0ULLaQp7roGRqgqgnWnnQ%3D%3D,Data Engineer,Mavie,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Engineer – Public Sector (Belgium)
Languages: Dutch, French, English (trilingual ideally – see note below)

We are supporting a major public sector organization in Belgium in the recruitment of an internal Data Engineer. This institution is responsible for critical infrastructure across the country and is currently investing heavily in its digital and data transformation. This is a long-term role within a stable, structured environment.

As a Data Engineer, you will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining robust data pipelines that serve both operational reporting and advanced analytics use cases. The technical landscape includes a mix of on-premise systems — with strong ties to SQL Server environments and SSIS — as well as a progressive shift towards cloud-native solutions on Azure, such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, and Databricks. You’ll bridge legacy systems and future-facing data platforms, helping to modernize how data is accessed and used across the organization.
Develop and optimize ETL processes connecting multiple source systems to data warehouses and reporting layers
Ensure reliability, performance, and scalability of data infrastructure, both on-prem and in the cloud
Collaborate with BI teams, architects, and business stakeholders to understand needs and implement sustainable data solutions
Monitor data flows, implement governance best practices, and contribute to long-term platform evolution
Strong experience in data engineering with tools such as SQL, Python, SSIS, and cloud services
Proven experience working in hybrid environments (on-prem + Azure)
Familiarity with data warehouse concepts, scheduling tools, and structured data lifecycle management
A pragmatic, autonomous mindset, with experience in complex and regulated environments

Language Note: While the official requirement is trilingualism (Dutch, French, English), we’ve been informed that for relatively senior candidates, fluency in just one national language (NL or FR) alongside English is often sufficient. Unfortunately, we don’t make the rules — but we’re happy to advise based on your profile.
This is a long-term opportunity to contribute to high-impact data initiatives in a collaborative public sector setting, with plenty of room for technical input and evolution.

4187001564,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-rwe-expert-at-planet-pharma-4187001564?position=2&pageNum=7&refId=lYBQMcSYmkMees2ehu5qAg%3D%3D&trackingId=sfeCLyk1zayObqAil66Zxg%3D%3D,Junior RWE Expert,Planet Pharma,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Title: Junior RWE Expert

Our client is a global biopharmaceutical company headquartered Belgium, specialising mainly in Neurology and Immunology, with presence in over 40 countries worldwide! Our client is currently looking for a Junior RWE (Real-World Evidence) Expert to join our Real World Evidence department, on a remote or hybrid basis.

Support RWE Study Design & Execution: Assist in planning, protocol development, and analysis specification while ensuring methodological best practices. Use real-world data to generate disease insights and epidemiological information.
Collaborate with External Partners: Work with external vendors on RWE projects.
Clarify Protocol & Analysis Plan Implementation: Provide guidance to RWE analysts on protocol execution.
Interpret Results: Analyze findings with RWE strategy leads and stakeholders, ensuring clear communication internally and externally.
Innovate Study Designs: Introduce new study design ideas, explore novel data sources, and apply advanced analytics, including digital pharmacoepidemiology.
Ph.D. or Master's degree in epidemiology, biostatistics, or a related field.
At least 3 years of experience designing and executing RWE studies in academia, consulting, or the pharmaceutical industry.
Familiarity with US and European healthcare systems.
Experience working with large healthcare databases (e.g., US claims data, UK CPRD, Nordic registries, SNDS).
Ability to generate insights supporting drug development and market access.
Knowledge of Ph1 and Ph2 trials, especially for Early RWE roles.
Ability to present RWE findings to non-technical audiences.
Interested? Apply now for immediate consideration or contact Maria Tsalpatourou at mtsalpatourou@planet-pharma.co.uk

Planet Pharma is an American parented Employment Business/Agency that provides global staffing services with its head-quarters in Chicago and our EMEA regional office located in Central London. We have invested significantly in creating a robust international platform that enables us to work compliantly in 30+ countries with a current network of 2500+ active contractors globally as well as a very strong permanent / direct hire recruitment offering.

Our specialist knowledge and close relationships with our clients and the wider industry really makes us unique in our field. Just recently we were recognised by FORBES as the 17th best professional staffing firm, and have won multiple awards from industry accredited bodies for our commitment to excellence and service delivery. We have extensive functional expertise including: Regulatory Affairs, Pharmacovigilance, QA, QC, Submissions experts, Clinical development, Quality, Biostatistics, and Medical Affairs / Writing.
We are an equal opportunities Recruitment Business and Agency.
We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

4208145359,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-harvey-nash-4208145359?position=5&pageNum=7&refId=lYBQMcSYmkMees2ehu5qAg%3D%3D&trackingId=pz6NqVSvnw66SZxCCsOwcA%3D%3D,Data Engineer,Harvey Nash,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Are you a data enthusiast with a passion for turning complex challenges into clean, scalable solutions? Join us as a Senior Data Engineer and bring your 5+ years of experience to the forefront of innovation—designing smart data pipelines, coding with precision, and driving real impact with cutting-edge tools like Apache Spark, AWS, and Python.

For a strong player in the banking industry, we are looking for a Data Engineer. As a senior Data Engineer, you have over 5 years of experience in creating designs and codes for data processing pipelines :
- You comprehend the functional design, based on the functional specifications, and translate this into a technical design
- You develop the necessary code to capture and process the data
- You set up and schedule automated data pipelines
- You maintain high standards for the quality of the code
- You provide the necessary tests for implementing the test strategy.

Next to a proven experience in data management and software development, you have the following core competences : Agile Methodologies, Analytical thinking, Collaborating, Data driven, Eager to learn, Independent, Problem solving, Result driven.

4190931742,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-solidaris-wallonie-4190931742?position=6&pageNum=7&refId=lYBQMcSYmkMees2ehu5qAg%3D%3D&trackingId=pC8CSJ78V90YW20aiWpcJw%3D%3D,Data Engineer,Solidaris Wallonie,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Afin de relever de nombreux défis, Solidaris recrute, pour un poste à Bruxelles, un :

*L’usage du masculin comme norme grammaticale dans cette offre d’emploi est une convention visant la lisibilité de son contenu. Ceci n’appelle aucune discrimination de genre dans le traitement des candidatures.
En tant que Data Engineer, vous concevez, gérez et optimisez la plateforme Data de Solidaris.

Vous collectez, intégrez et assurez la qualité des données pour permettre à l'entreprise d'interpréter les données, de prendre les bonnes décisions, de proposer des pistes de réflexion et d'améliorer les performances.

À partir des besoins exprimés et des données disponibles, vous élaborez un modèle de données d’entreprise (GED/EDM) servant de couche sémantique, enrichi par des données de référence. Ce modèle unifie, formalise et représente les concepts importants pour Solidaris ainsi que les règles d'application. Il est utilisé pour divers produits de données.
Vous identifiez les besoins métiers, centralisez les demandes et développez l’EDM de manière itérative pour une modélisation logique et physique efficace.
Vous développez l’EDM de manière itérative afin de répondre efficacement aux besoins de données.
Vous concevez, adaptez, implémentez et maintenez l’EDM sous forme de tables physiques sur la plateforme Data, garantissant ainsi le bon fonctionnement des services internes.
Vous transformez les demandes métiers en pipelines de données, en code et en lakehouses.
Vous créez et maintenez des pipelines de données, mettez en place des lakehouses et veillez à la qualité des données qu’ils contiennent.
Vous êtes responsable d’une nomenclature claire et de la documentation des différents champs dans les vues (sur la plateforme de données et le catalogue de données).
Vous organisez l'accès aux espaces de travail en ligne avec la politique de données pour éviter les fuites de données.
Vous êtes en charge des tests des produits de données en collaboration avec l’entreprise.
Vous interagissez avec divers acteurs (managers, chefs de projet, architectes, analystes) et rapportez au Lead Data Engineer.
Vous vous reconnaissez dans le profil suivant :
Vous possédez un master avec au moins 5 ans d'expérience en modélisation de données.
Vous avez l’expérience et des connaissances approfondies :
En langages de programmation (SQL, Python, Pyspark)
En plateforme de données modernes (Microsoft Fabric, Microsoft Azure, Databricks, Snowflake…)
En plateformes BI (Cognos, Power BI, Tableau…)
En gestion de projets et méthodologie Agile.
Vous êtes capable de penser de manière abstraite et de développer des modèles conceptuels.
Vous êtes capable d'évaluer correctement les demandes de données et de gérer votre temps efficacement.
Vous êtes capable de développer l'EDM de manière incrémentale.
Vous savez comment donner du feedback constructif afin de permettre à votre équipe de grandir.
Vous assurez la qualité et la conformité des données RGPD.
Vous êtes bilingue français/néerlandais. La connaissance de l'anglais est un atout.

Le département informatique de Solidaris se compose d'environ 200 informaticiens qui développent des applications pour toutes les mutualités affiliées, leurs guichets (800) et services internes, répartis dans toute la Belgique. Ces applications sont utilisées par plus de 3500 personnes et permettent environ 4 millions de transactions par jour.
Vous travaillerez au sein d'un environnement de travail convivial où l’humain a vraiment sa place et où nous respectons l’équilibre vie privée/vie professionnelle.
Vous pourrez compter sur des opportunités de formations riches et épanouissantes pour accompagner au mieux votre intégration et votre évolution dans l’entreprise.

Nous vous proposons un contrat à durée indéterminée à temps plein (35h/semaine dans un horaire flexible), la possibilité de télétravailler et divers avantages extralégaux (chèques-repas, assurance groupe, assurance hospitalisation, minimum 25 jours de congés et des jours de récupération).
Nous sommes situés à 5 minutes à pied de la Grand Place de Bruxelles et à 300 mètres du bureau.
Postulez sans plus tarder en envoyant votre CV accompagné de votre lettre de motivation avant le 16 avril 2025.

Afin de relever de nombreux défis, Solidaris recrute, pour un poste à Bruxelles, un :

Data Engineer (H/F/X)*

4208888367,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/research-executive-at-publicis-groupe-belgium-4208888367?position=7&pageNum=7&refId=lYBQMcSYmkMees2ehu5qAg%3D%3D&trackingId=HCM8I0hyAOlttd4ku7LpVg%3D%3D,Research Executive,Publicis Groupe Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Company Description

At Publicis Groupe Belgium we are driven by the Power of One. That’s our raison d’être: to make brands relevant and interesting to people, in order to touch them and influence their behavior, to grow the business of the brands we work for. More than 200 diverse bright experts are organized in 4 interconnected métiers (strategy & data, creative experiences, media activation, and production), and are the drivers of our collective creativity. And ow, yeah, it’s “Groupe” with an “e”. With our group’s roots in la douce France you can expect loads of Liberté, Curiosité and Créativité.

In this function, you work within the fun-loving and diverse Strategy & Data team of Publicis Groupe. You will be showcasing your (lack of) music taste in multiple Spotify-playlists with your colleagues and support them in better understanding people through your knowledge and skill in qualitative and quantitative research and turning data into insight.

Comms Strategy is one of the 4 focus teams within Strategy & Data and as a Comms Analyst / Research Executive you play a central role in supporting our data science (in close collaboration with the Data Analysis-team) and market research solutions and platforms. You are also actively involved in driving innovation within our practice.
You manage and optimize the day-to-day research operations of our Effects Tracking-portfolio in close collaboration with Comms Strategists

You develop interview guides, questionnaires and research plannings and conduct interviews, focus groups and online quantitative research for bespoke and standardized Publicis Groupe research solutions
Together with your colleagues in Data Analysis you oversee analysis of research results and dashboarding solutions for reporting purposes
You support Comms Strategists in getting the best out of tools like Nielsen Wizzad+, Kantar BMM, GlobalWebIndex and more
You contribute in the development of POV and research around topics relevant in media and advertising (cfr. our Summer of Sports-research project in 2024)
You collaborate with stakeholders in the Comms Strategy- & Data Analysis-teams to further explore the possibilities of our proprietary BioLogic AI insights platform

It is your courage, thinking and how you connect with others that makes the real difference. The role is always adapted to the personality, never the other way around. This is what matters most to us. We can teach you our methods, processes, and frameworks, but you can teach us to make them work. However, seen the central position you take

You have a critical mindset, because you are committed, and want to put it to use for brands, people, and society

You have an education that has allowed you to have a solid understanding of statistics and market research basics
You have excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
You can work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
You are fluent in English and Dutch and/or French to navigate our diverse multinational culture and environment
Do you believe that you can play a central role in helping us become the reference agency for the Age of Opportunity? Let’s talk!

Next to a proven experience in data management and software development, you have the following core competences : Agile Methodologies, Analytical thinking, Collaborating, Data driven, Eager to learn, Independent, Problem solving, Result driven.

Languages: English

Employment Type: Freelancer/Employee

4199859456,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-engie-global-energy-management-sales-gems-4199859456?position=1&pageNum=10&refId=fWRyTsR9Ji2bh05F0jDY9w%3D%3D&trackingId=cN2ZXr%2B85poqb%2FQiqijIBg%3D%3D,Data Engineer,ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS),"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity ""Global Energy Management & Sales"" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.
More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The applicant will join the ""Digital and Data Accelerator"" (DDA) team. The primary objective of this team is to develop high-quality data products for our clients, focusing on critical areas such as fundamental data collection, historical asset data compilation, and production and consumption forecasting models. This initiative plays a vital role in optimizing resource allocation and advancing decarbonization efforts. The DDA team engages in various strategic activities, including the development and rationalization of data projects, ensuring robust data governance, and maintaining high data quality standards. We collaborate closely with the GEMS business unit to enhance data utilization efficiency. Furthermore, the team is tasked with structuring and piloting the data strategy within GEMS, reinforcing governance practices, and implementing a cohesive data architecture. Role: Working hand in hand with business and IT teams, the Data Engineer will:
Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines.
Ensure the availability and quality of data.
Optimize the performance of data processing systems.
Interact with data scientists to understand their needs and adapt pipelines accordingly.
Implement best development practices and monitor production systems.
Particular care will be necessary to:
Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.
Proficiency in big data frameworks such as Spark and Databricks.
Experience with data pipeline tools and ETL processes.
Good knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, in particular AWS S3, Glue, Athena or equivalent.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and best practices.
DevOps, infra as code, continuous integration and delivery concepts.
Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical thinking.
Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with data scientists and other team members.
Ability to work well in a team-oriented environment.
Adaptability and willingness to learn new technologies and methodologies.
Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
Master’s degree in engineering with a proven specialty in IT or equivalent.
Previous experience in the implementation and customization of data pipelines
Language: English as a working language
Occasional travels to Brussels are expected
If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!
Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.
ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Context: The applicant will join the ""Digital and Data Accelerator"" (DDA) team. The primary objective of this team is to develop high-quality data products for our clients, focusing on critical areas such as fundamental data collection, historical asset data compilation, and production and consumption forecasting models. This initiative plays a vital role in optimizing resource allocation and advancing decarbonization efforts.   • Optimize the performance of data processing systems.

  • Implement best development practices and monitor production systems.

Particular care will be necessary to:

  • Optimize pipeline performance.

  • Quickly resolve incidents.

Hard skills:

Education and professional background:

  • Previous experience in the implementation and customization of data pipelines

Languages:

Travels:

4204921895,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/r-d-data-science-internship-at-procter-gamble-4204921895?position=2&pageNum=10&refId=fWRyTsR9Ji2bh05F0jDY9w%3D%3D&trackingId=fW3cwmum36%2FXYplCQJ0%2BFw%3D%3D,R&D Data Science internship,Procter & Gamble,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Location
Are you passionate about the science behind products? Do you want to develop innovations for the world's biggest brands? Then a technical career at P&G could be what you are looking for!
Join us for an internship and you could soon leave your mark in fields like natural sciences, materials, automation, sustainability, analytics, simulation and modelling through your project.

We are looking for R&D Data Science intern who will help Fabric & Home Care by leveraging data-driven insights through machine learning and deep learning techniques, including convolutional neural networks, to enhance product and packaging performance and innovate solutions that meet consumer needs. In this role, you will analyze consumer data and develop predictive models all while collaborating with a dynamic team.
You will get a chance to gain industrial experience and experience what working with us is like
You will be responsible for your own project(s) from day 1 and put your technical skills to work on some of the toughest technical challenges
You will improve your collaboration and management skills through practical experience and interactive training courses
You get to experience the working environment in a leading international company and learn to work effectively with people of different nationalities and cultural backgrounds.
YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:
Masters students in Software engineering, Data science, Data engineering, instead of just Software Engineering.
Students who will be enrolled at university for the full period of the internship
Demonstrated history of academic excellence at all stages through school and university education
Passion and ability to take initiative and make things happen
Be technically curious, creative and innovative
Have a good communication and collaboration skills
If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.
A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package
Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction

Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities
Flexibility in terms of working hours
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.
ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:
Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

IT Link, expert des systèmes connectés

Chez IT Link, cela fait 35 ans que nous misons sur la connexion des technologies, des objets et des personnes pour apporter des réponses aux grands défis actuels de notre société (environnement, santé, sécurité…).
Nous accompagnons nos clients dans leurs projets d’innovation et de transformation, des technologies embarquées à l’application métier en passant par le cloud et la science des données.

Pour cela, nous comptons sur nos 750 Linkers présent.e.s sur 14 agences réparties dans le monde (France, Benelux, Canada et Maroc). A horizon 2025, l’objectif est d’atteindre 1000 collaborateurs.trices pour soutenir notre forte croissance.

• Concevoir et optimiser des infrastructures cloud AWS performantes et sécurisées.
  • Implémenter des pipelines de données et des processus ETL pour un traitement efficace des données.
  • Développer et tester des modèles avancés pour optimiser les performances des batteries.
  • Analyser de grands ensembles de données afin d’améliorer l’efficacité opérationnelle.
  • Intégrer des solutions data-driven aux systèmes existants et documenter les processus.
  • Assurer la disponibilité et la sécurité des services cloud.


Requirements

Profil recherché:

  • Proven expertise in AWS services (EC2, S3, Lambda, CloudFormation, etc.).
  • Strong experience in pipeline creation and DevOps methodologies.
  • Hands-on experience with ETL processes and agile methodologies.
  • Knowledge of cloud security best practices.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently.


Nice to Have

  • Experience in energy trading or financial markets.
  • Knowledge of Kubernetes and containerization technologies.
  • Strong background in data analysis and machine learning.
  • Scripting experience (Python, Bash, etc.).


A Propos

Welcome to Sansaone, a dynamic force in the realm of ICT talent acquisition. Born out of a passion for excellence and a vision for connecting outstanding professionals with forward-thinking organizations, we stand as a beacon for strategic recruitment solutions in the Information and Communication Technology sector. With a commitment to excellence and a passion for connecting exceptional professionals with innovative organizations, we are your strategic partner in building transformative teams.
We currently have a vacancy for a Data Engineer fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert in Valletta, Malta.

The work will be carried out either remotely or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client’s IT team on site.
Design, develop, document, and maintain ETL/ELT processes, data integration, cleaning, transformation, dissemination and automation processes.
Design, develop, document and maintain data architecture, data modelling and metadata.
Develop and support data warehouse/lakehouse architectures and data processing ensuring data quality, lineage, auditing, metadata, logging, linkage across datasets and impact assessments.
Develop and maintain business intelligence models, interactive dashboards, reports and analytics using tools such as Databricks, Jupyter Notebooks, and Power BI.
Design, develop, document, improve and maintain the Data Warehouse/Lakehouse ecosystem (e.g. the DataDevOps lifecycle, architecture).
Contribute to the definition and documentation of data governance policies, procedures, standards, and metadata models.
University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 6 years of relevant working experience in IT.
Experience with development and data processing using e.g. Python, SQL, Power M and DAX.
Experience with structured, semi-structured and unstructured data types and related file format (e.g. JSON, Parquet, Delta).
Experience with gathering business requirements and transforming it into data collection, integration and analysis processes.

Experience in Microsoft On-Prem and Azure Data Platform tools (such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, SQL Server, ADLS, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric/Power BI, Azure DevOps, Azure AI Services, PowerShell).
Experience in CI/CD lifecycle using Azure DevOps.
Experience in Databricks ecosystem, Apache Spark and Python data processing libraries.
Experience with Data Modelling principles and methods.
Experience with Data Lakes and Data Lakehouse architecture, concepts and governance.
Experience with Data Integration and data warehouse/lakehouse modelling techniques, concepts and methods (e.g. SCD, Functional Engineering, Data Vault, Data Streaming, etc).
Experience with data governance and data management standards, policies, processes, metadata, quality, etc.
Experience with WebAPIs and OpenAPI standard.
Knowledge of DAMA Data Management best practices and standards.
Knowledge of Data Governance and Discovery tools such as Azure Purview.
Knowledge of Master data and reference data management concepts.
Knowledge of Business glossaries, data dictionaries, and data catalogues.
Knowledge of Moodle or other Learning Management System.
Excellent command of the English language.

Job Description

Welcome to Sansaone, a dynamic force in the realm of ICT talent acquisition. Born out of a passion for excellence and a vision for connecting outstanding professionals with forward-thinking organizations, we stand as a beacon for strategic recruitment solutions in the Information and Communication Technology sector. With a commitment to excellence and a passion for connecting exceptional professionals with innovative organizations, we are your strategic partner in building transformative teams.

We currently have a vacancy for a Data Engineer fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert in Valletta, Malta.

  • The work will be carried out either remotely or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client’s IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • Design, develop, document, and maintain ETL/ELT processes, data integration, cleaning, transformation, dissemination and automation processes.
  • Design, develop, document and maintain data architecture, data modelling and metadata.
  • Develop and support data warehouse/lakehouse architectures and data processing ensuring data quality, lineage, auditing, metadata, logging, linkage across datasets and impact assessments.
  • Develop and maintain business intelligence models, interactive dashboards, reports and analytics using tools such as Databricks, Jupyter Notebooks, and Power BI.
  • Design, develop, document, improve and maintain the Data Warehouse/Lakehouse ecosystem (e.g. the DataDevOps lifecycle, architecture).
  • Contribute to the definition and documentation of data governance policies, procedures, standards, and metadata models.

Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 6 years of relevant working experience in IT.
  • Experience with development and data processing using e.g. Python, SQL, Power M and DAX.
  • Experience with structured, semi-structured and unstructured data types and related file format (e.g. JSON, Parquet, Delta).
  • Experience with gathering business requirements and transforming it into data collection, integration and analysis processes.
  • Experience in Microsoft On-Prem and Azure Data Platform tools (such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, SQL Server, ADLS, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric/Power BI, Azure DevOps, Azure AI Services, PowerShell).
  • Experience in CI/CD lifecycle using Azure DevOps.
  • Experience in Databricks ecosystem, Apache Spark and Python data processing libraries.
  • Experience with Data Modelling principles and methods.
  • Experience with Data Lakes and Data Lakehouse architecture, concepts and governance.
  • Experience with Data Integration and data warehouse/lakehouse modelling techniques, concepts and methods (e.g. SCD, Functional Engineering, Data Vault, Data Streaming, etc).
  • Experience with data governance and data management standards, policies, processes, metadata, quality, etc.
  • Experience with WebAPIs and OpenAPI standard.
  • Knowledge of DAMA Data Management best practices and standards.
  • Knowledge of Data Governance and Discovery tools such as Azure Purview.
  • Knowledge of Master data and reference data management concepts.
  • Knowledge of Business glossaries, data dictionaries, and data catalogues.
  • Knowledge of Moodle or other Learning Management System.
  • Excellent command of the English language.

The aim is to alleviate operational tasks from internal staff, allowing them to concentrate on managerial responsibilities.
This is a mission until the end of December 2025, with possible extension and can offer flexible working with some site presence in Brussels.
The rate on offer is a maximum of 75-80 eur per hour, 40 hours per week, however 30 hours per week can be considered as well. English language is a must.
Your duties as the Statistical Computing Support Specialist will be varied however the key duties and responsibilities are as follows:
As the Statistical Computing Support Specialist, you will assist in setting up, migrating, and supporting statistical computing environments.
