4208126674,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-and-reporting-analyst-at-lombard-odier-group-4208126674?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=cacs0YQD8jOEB25UNDqfAA%3D%3D,Data and Reporting Analyst,Lombard Odier Group,"Geneva, Switzerland","A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.

With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.

“Rethink Everything” is our philosophy – it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.

We report on the evolution of LOIM’s Financials (Assets under Management, Revenues and Costs) to various internal and external stakeholders. We manage LOIM’s revenue processes and implement LOIM’s transfer pricing policies. We provide Financial Planning and Analysis to LOIM’s business lines and to the Lombard Odier Group.
Develop, maintain and run workflows that prepare data and ensure data quality for facts and dimensions feeding our dashboards and reports
Collaborate with our internal data providers (IT, Operations, Business Dev) in projects, production and troubleshooting
Produce, maintain and upgrade dashboards, reports and ad-hoc analysis intended for Senior Management, Investment teams, Business Development
Participate to the preparation of Revenue forecasts
Drive various projects, e.g. improvement of existing data management processes, design dashboards that address new business requirements, integrate new data sources
3-5 years of experience in a similar role
Experience working with large datasets and building reports for various stakeholders
Strong technical skills, including experience with Alteryx and Tableau, Microsoft office (Excel/Access, VBA), Cognos ReportNet a plus
Genuine interest for the financial industry and investment products
Technically minded and detail oriented with strong conceptual and problem solving skills
Organized, ability to progress on multiple concurrent tasks with autonomy
Team player with good communication skills
Very good written and spoken English and French

Our Maison’s DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.

As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison’s DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy.
It is an exciting time to join our Teams. All applications will be handled in the strictest confidence.

4203769113,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-power-bi-looker-at-bechtle-schweiz-ag-4203769113?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=QdHzVtTm8gxEQPPfxj%2BjJg%3D%3D,Data Analyst Power BI / Looker,Bechtle Schweiz AG,"Neuchâtel, Neuchâtel, Switzerland","Be your best with bechtle
Avec plus de 14 000 employés, nous sommes l'une des entreprises informatiques les plus prospères et les leaders du marché dans notre secteur.

L’association de la vente directe de produits informatiques et d'une gamme complète de prestations de services proposée par les différentes sociétés de services informatiques fait de nous un partenaire informatique fort et porteur d’avenir (« zukunftsstark ») pour les entreprises moyennes, les grands groupes et le secteur public. Nous sommes chez nous dans toute l’Europe et toujours près de chez vous.
Pour le compte de notre client du canton de Neuchâtel, nous recherchons un Ingénieur Power BI / Looker.
Concevoir et faire évoluer des rapports Power BI complexes : modélisation, DAX, performance
Assurer la fiabilité des modèles de données tabulaires et optimiser les requêtes
Participer à la documentation, l’industrialisation et la gouvernance des rapports BI
Travailler en lien étroit avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre et répondre aux besoins
Accompagner progressivement la migration vers Looker pour les rapports identifiés comme éligibles
Expérience confirmée avec Power BI (modèle de données, mesures DAX, Power Query)
Une bonne expérience de Looker / LookML est un réel atout
Maîtrise du SQL pour l’extraction et la transformation de données
Bonne compréhension des architectures BI (data warehouse, modèles tabulaires)
Capacité à évoluer dans un environnement structuré, exigeant et collaboratif
Diversité : des tâches intéressantes et changeantes dans un secteur tourné vers l’avenir
Conditions de travail avantageuses : 6 semaines de vacances par an et un plan de prévoyance attractif
Développement et mise en valeur du potentiel : vaste gamme de formations professionnelles et personnelles proposées par l'Académie Bechtle

4209808236,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-insight-analyst-at-lastminute-com-4209808236?position=9&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=yE4rQUg4cz9BKEOziLsgvg%3D%3D,Business Insight Analyst,lastminute.com,"Chiasso, Ticino, Switzerland","At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.

We are looking for a Business Insight Analyst to join our Ancillaries & Strategy team in Chiasso. This is a great opportunity to apply your analytical skills and contribute to improving business performance through data-driven insights.

The candidate will be primarily involved in the Ancillaries area, focusing on pricing strategies, customer segmentation, and market behavior analysis. The role involves supporting development teams with data and insights, helping to shape product roadmaps and enhance the group’s digital assets.
The candidate will also have the opportunity to present findings to senior management, gaining valuable exposure to strategic decision-making and C-level stakeholders.
Team - you will join the Ancillaries & Strategy team within the Operations - Platform department.
Analyzing big data, determining customer trends and delivering insight to drive business performance
Closely partner with Product team, driving decision making and strategy with data and analytical insight
Executing multiple projects across teams to successfully achieve specific goals and objectives
Implementing strategies and defining models to accelerate and optimize revenue growth
1-3 years of experience in Data/Business analyst role in a fast-paced environment
Proven experience of delivering value thanks to data-driven analysis
Excellent knowledge of Excel and SQL programming language
Fluency in English both written and verbal
Ability to influence decision-makers through presentation of analysis
Familiarity with digital and e-commerce business
Previous experience in the travel industry
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you’ll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.

- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O’reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)
Wish you were here? We do, too!
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)
Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.
Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.
HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.
Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.
HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.
You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.
You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.
You speak English fluently (French is a plus).
You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.
HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?
This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.
Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment
Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
  • Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
  • Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
  • Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
  • Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
  • Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

4195448430,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-m-f-d-at-chaberton-professionals-4195448430?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=xIO6uX%2FtKF96Mx0R5gmj1g%3D%3D,Data Analyst (m/f/d),Chaberton Professionals,"Lucerne, Switzerland","Founded in Switzerland, Chaberton Professionals is the Management Recruitment division of Chaberton Partners, specializing in the search and selection of middle and senior management profiles. For the past seven years, we have reinforced our Swiss presence with key offices in Lugano, Zurich, Geneva, Lausanne, and Bern, supported by our team of 230 experienced Consultants and Board Members.

Our client is an industrial multinational player leader in its industry. To support the set-up of their global procurement Center of Excellence in Switzerland, we are supporting them in the search for an experienced Data Analyst based in Root, Lucerne.
The person will facilitate the procurement team with a centralized spend analytics database that supports data-driven decision making, identification of savings opportunities and savings tracking.
Create and maintain the company’s global procurement database:
-Bring together spend data from multiple ERPs into one unified platform for analytics
-Normalize, cleanse, and classify data to support global analytics
-Ongoing spend data refresh from existing and new ERPs
Work with category leads to define useful analytics.
Design visualizations to present data in a clear and concise manner for relevant stakeholders.
Develop should cost modeling and support Category Leads in using model.
Develop total cost of ownership calculations and support Category Leads in using calculator
Track and report CoE value generation.
Support Business Partners in interfacing with Finance on reporting and budgeting.
Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Finance, or related field.
Experience in a similar role demonstrating strong analytics, data normalization and cleansing, ERP understanding, data visualization, and stakeholder management.
Ability to comfortably work with large datasets.
Demonstrated ability to partner with and manage internal stakeholders.
Proven experience in leveraging data analytics for strategic decision-making.
Strong financial reporting background with expertise in collaborating with finance teams.
Familiarity with advanced analytics tools and reporting frameworks.
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, SQL, and/or Python.
Fluent spoken and written English, any other language is a plus.
Type of position: Permanent, full-time position

We care about each application. Should you not hear from us within two weeks, it would imply that we have proceeded with other candidates based on the specific requirements of the role. Please note that this decision does not reflect your skills or professional experience but is rather based on the specific needs and requirements of the current position.

Founded in Switzerland, Chaberton Professionals is the Management Recruitment division of Chaberton Partners, specializing in the search and selection of middle and senior management profiles. For the past seven years, we have reinforced our Swiss presence with key offices in Lugano, Zurich, Geneva, Lausanne, and Bern, supported by our team of 230 experienced Consultants and Board Members.


Data Analyst (m/f/d)


The position:

Our client is an industrial multinational player leader in its industry. To support the set-up of their global procurement Center of Excellence in Switzerland, we are supporting them in the search for an experienced Data Analyst based in Root, Lucerne.

The person will facilitate the procurement team with a centralized spend analytics database that supports data-driven decision making, identification of savings opportunities and savings tracking.


Main responsibilities:

  • Create and maintain the company’s global procurement database:

-Bring together spend data from multiple ERPs into one unified platform for analytics

-Normalize, cleanse, and classify data to support global analytics

-Ongoing spend data refresh from existing and new ERPs

  • Create and update category dashboards
  • Work with category leads to define useful analytics.
  • Design visualizations to present data in a clear and concise manner for relevant stakeholders.
  • Develop should cost modeling and support Category Leads in using model.
  • Develop total cost of ownership calculations and support Category Leads in using calculator
  • Track and report CoE value generation.
  • Support Business Partners in interfacing with Finance on reporting and budgeting.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Finance, or related field.
  • Experience in a similar role demonstrating strong analytics, data normalization and cleansing, ERP understanding, data visualization, and stakeholder management.
  • Ability to comfortably work with large datasets.
  • Demonstrated ability to partner with and manage internal stakeholders.
  • Proven experience in leveraging data analytics for strategic decision-making.
  • Strong financial reporting background with expertise in collaborating with finance teams.
  • Familiarity with advanced analytics tools and reporting frameworks.
  • Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, SQL, and/or Python.
  • Fluent spoken and written English, any other language is a plus.


Location: Root, Switzerland

Type of position: Permanent, full-time position


We care about each application. Should you not hear from us within two weeks, it would imply that we have proceeded with other candidates based on the specific requirements of the role. Please note that this decision does not reflect your skills or professional experience but is rather based on the specific needs and requirements of the current position.

4198001997,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-%E2%80%93-supply-chain-at-unilabs-switzerland-4198001997?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=lB5xgmiYvUGd0d10TDFnmQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst – Supply Chain,Unilabs Switzerland,"Coppet, Vaud, Switzerland","Introduction
Unilabs is the largest provider of medical laboratory diagnostics for prescribers and hospitals in Switzerland and employs around 800 people.

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our Supply Chain team to support our company transformation project. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing supply chain data, identifying trends, and providing insights to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and optimize processes. The Data Analyst will collaborate closely with other departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
Data Collection & Management: Gather, clean, and manage large datasets from various sources, including internal ERP systems and external suppliers.

Data Analysis: Perform in-depth analysis to identify trends, bottlenecks, and inefficiencies in supply chain processes such as inventory management, lead times, supplier performance, and transportation.

Reporting & Visualization: Develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders. Utilize tools like Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or similar software.
Forecasting & Modeling: Support inventory optimization, and capacity planning using statistical models and data analysis techniques.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and alignment with supply chain goals.
Process Improvement: Provide actionable insights to improve supply chain performance, reduce costs, and enhance customer satisfaction through data-driven strategies.
Key Performance Indicators & Metrics: Track and analyze supply chain KPIs.
Ad Hoc Analysis: Conduct special projects and analyses as needed to support strategic initiatives in the supply chain function.
Experience: minimum 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within supply chain, logistics, or manufacturing industries.
Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in supply chain management, Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent.
Experience with database management and querying (e.g., SQL) is an advantage.
Experience with ERP migration is an advantage.
Knowledge of supply chain management systems (ERP, WMS) is a plus.
Analytical Mindset: Strong problem-solving skills and ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present findings clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to Detail: High degree of accuracy and attention to detail when working with complex datasets.
Languages: Advanced command of English. and French or German

Introduction

Your Tasks

The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing supply chain data, identifying trends, and providing insights to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and optimize processes. The Data Analyst will collaborate closely with other departments to drive data-informed decision-making.

Key responsibilities

  • Data Collection &
column2:
Management: Gather, clean, and manage large datasets from various sources, including internal ERP systems and external suppliers.
  • Data Analysis: Perform in-depth analysis to identify trends, bottlenecks, and inefficiencies in supply chain processes such as inventory management, lead times, supplier performance, and transportation.
  • Reporting &
column3:
Visualization: Develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders. Utilize tools like Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or similar software.
  • Forecasting &
column4:
Modeling: Support inventory optimization, and capacity planning using statistical models and data analysis techniques.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and alignment with supply chain goals.
  • Process Improvement: Provide actionable insights to improve supply chain performance, reduce costs, and enhance customer satisfaction through data-driven strategies.
  • Key Performance Indicators &
column5:
Metrics: Track and analyze supply chain KPIs.
  • Ad Hoc Analysis: Conduct special projects and analyses as needed to support strategic initiatives in the supply chain function.

    • Your Profile

    • Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present findings clearly to non-technical stakeholders.

    • Languages: Advanced command of English. and French or German

Talan est un groupe international de conseil et d’expertises technologiques qui accélère la transformation de ses clients par les leviers de l'innovation, la technologie et la data. Depuis plus de 20 ans, Talan conseille et accompagne les entreprises et les institutions publiques dans la mise en œuvre de leurs projets de transformation et d'innovation en France et à l'international.

Présent sur cinq continents, dans 18 pays, le Groupe, certifié Great Place To Work, qui comptera plus de 7200 collaborateurs fin 2024, ambitionne de réaliser un chiffre d'affaires de 850 millions d'euros cette même année et de dépasser la barre du milliard d'euros à horizon 2025.

Doté d'un Centre de recherche et d'innovation, Talan met l'innovation au cœur de son développement et intervient dans les domaines des mutations technologiques telles que l'Intelligence Artificielle, la Data Intelligence, la Blockchain, pour servir la croissance des grands groupes et des ETI dans une démarche engagée et responsable. www.talan.com
En plaçant au cœur de sa stratégie « L’innovation Positive » le Groupe Talan est convaincu que c’est en étant au service de l’humain que la technologie démultiplie son potentiel pour la société.
Concevoir et développer des rapports et dashboards dynamiques avec Looker et Power BI, adaptés aux besoins métiers
Participer à la modélisation de données, notamment à partir de modèles SAP, pour garantir la fiabilité et la cohérence des analyses
Collaborer avec des équipes pluridisciplinaires dans un environnement data-driven utilisant des technologies modernes comme Fivetran, GCP, et SAP
Assurer le suivi, la documentation et l’optimisation continue des solutions déployées
Expertise confirmée de Looker (min. 2 ans d’expérience), et très bonne maîtrise de Power BI
Connaissance des modèles de données SAP et des environnements industriels
À l’aise dans un écosystème moderne intégrant GCP, Fivetran, et des pipelines de données complexes
Esprit analytique, rigueur, et sens du travail en équipe

Talan est un groupe international de conseil et d’expertises technologiques qui accélère la transformation de ses clients par les leviers de l'innovation, la technologie et la data. Depuis plus de 20 ans, Talan conseille et accompagne les entreprises et les institutions publiques dans la mise en œuvre de leurs projets de transformation et d'innovation en France et à l'international.



Présent sur cinq continents, dans 18 pays, le Groupe, certifié Great Place To Work, qui comptera plus de 7200 collaborateurs fin 2024, ambitionne de réaliser un chiffre d'affaires de 850 millions d'euros cette même année et de dépasser la barre du milliard d'euros à horizon 2025.



Doté d'un Centre de recherche et d'innovation, Talan met l'innovation au cœur de son développement et intervient dans les domaines des mutations technologiques telles que l'Intelligence Artificielle, la Data Intelligence, la Blockchain, pour servir la croissance des grands groupes et des ETI dans une démarche engagée et responsable. www.talan.com



En plaçant au cœur de sa stratégie « L’innovation Positive » le Groupe Talan est convaincu que c’est en étant au service de l’humain que la technologie démultiplie son potentiel pour la société.




Job Description


Vos missions :



  • Concevoir et développer des rapports et dashboards dynamiques avec Looker et Power BI, adaptés aux besoins métiers



  • Participer à la modélisation de données, notamment à partir de modèles SAP, pour garantir la fiabilité et la cohérence des analyses



  • Collaborer avec des équipes pluridisciplinaires dans un environnement data-driven utilisant des technologies modernes comme Fivetran, GCP, et SAP



  • Assurer le suivi, la documentation et l’optimisation continue des solutions déployées






Qualifications


  • Expertise confirmée de Looker (min. 2 ans d’expérience), et très bonne maîtrise de Power BI



  • Connaissance des modèles de données SAP et des environnements industriels



  • À l’aise dans un écosystème moderne intégrant GCP, Fivetran, et des pipelines de données complexes



  • Esprit analytique, rigueur, et sens du travail en équipe

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.
For our Web- & eCommerce Team we are looking for an additional member, who can be a full-time intern as well as staying with us longer term as a part-time working student.
As we have multiple different projects, we are able to offer interesting topics for students who are looking to gain some experience in fields such as
column2: data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

column1: Functional and semantic similarity modelling for chemical products
Exposing training materials with interactive chatbots
Website parsing with AI avoiding hallucinations and information loss
Visibility to IT management if that is perceived motivating
Well defined projects in case school requires formal documentations for credit(s)
database technologies and a query language
English language is needed, German/Spanish knowledge is advantage

We look forward to your direct online application.

Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

For our Web- &
column2:
eCommerce Team we are looking for an additional member, who can be a full-time intern as well as staying with us longer term as a part-time working student.

As we have multiple different projects, we are able to offer interesting topics for students who are looking to gain some experience in fields such as
column3:
data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

  • Functional and semantic similarity modelling for chemical products
  • Recommendation/ranking algorithms for eCommerce platform

Qualifications

Basic understanding of:

  • at least one programming/scripting language
  • database technologies and a query language
  • data engineering and science basics

Soft Skills

Additional Information

4192565314,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-audemars-piguet-4192565314?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=Z4wtZdNBwsEjC0a%2BurPTEg%3D%3D,Data Engineer,Audemars Piguet,"Le Chenit, Vaud, Switzerland","Description de l'entreprise

Le présent et le futur d’Audemars Piguet se construisent grâce à la contribution de tous nos talents. Inspirés par la richesse de notre passé, nous sommes enthousiastes à l’idée de ce que nous créerons dans le futur. Ensemble, nous sommes résolument tournés vers l’avenir et en quête continue d’excellence dans tous nos métiers.
Si notre mission vous inspire, venez poursuivre votre parcours au sein de notre famille pour que l’on continue de créer l'extraordinaire. Écrivons le prochain chapitre de votre carrière ensemble !

Au sein de notre Data Office, nous recherchons notre futur Data Engineer. Vous serez responsable de la conception et de la mise en œuvre d'architectures de données robustes, tout en assurant la conformité aux réglementations et en améliorant la performance des systèmes de traitement des données. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de Data, les équipes IT et les autres départements pour comprendre les besoins en données et fournir des solutions adaptées.
Vous élaborez et mettez en œuvre des architectures de données solides, incluant bases de données, entrepôts de données et systèmes de traitement des données en temps réel
Vous planifiez et créez des structures de bases de données relationnelles pour garantir une récupération efficace et rapide des informations
Vous développez des systèmes capables de traiter des flux de données en temps réel pour répondre aux besoins opérationnels immédiats et assurer une prise de décision rapide
Vous assurez la conformité aux réglementations sur la protection des données et améliorez la performance des systèmes de traitement des données
Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de Data, les équipes IT et les autres départements pour comprendre les besoins en données et fournir des solutions adaptées
Vous créez et mettez à jour la documentation technique, incluant guides d'utilisation et schémas techniques, pour faciliter la compréhension et la maintenance des solutions
Vous avez un diplôme de Master en informatique, en gestion des données, ou dans un domaine connexe
Vous justifiez de plus de 3 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Engineer
Vous justifiez d’une solide expérience avec les bases de données relationnelles, NoSQL, DBT, ETL (Talend ou équivalent), Python, Pyspark

Vous avez des compétences et connaissances avérées en conception et mise en œuvre d'architectures de données, des réglementations sur la protection des données et des meilleures pratiques en matière de sécurité des données
Vous possédez une expérience de développement dans le Cloud – la connaissance d’Azure Databricks est un plus
Vous avez des notions dans les concepts et technologies suivants : Spark, agilité, AI/GenAI
La prise en charge des assurances maladie (base et complémentaire)
5 semaines annuelles de vacances et 2 semaines supplémentaires entre Noël et Nouvel An grâce au cumul quotidien de minutes additionnelles
Une contribution à vos activités sportives ou culturelles
La possibilité selon la fonction de travailler à distance

Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.
Le masculin vaut pour le féminin.

Description de l'entreprise

Le présent et le futur d’Audemars Piguet se construisent grâce à la contribution de tous nos talents. Inspirés par la richesse de notre passé, nous sommes enthousiastes à l’idée de ce que nous créerons dans le futur. Ensemble, nous sommes résolument tournés vers l’avenir et en quête continue d’excellence dans tous nos métiers.

Si notre mission vous inspire, venez poursuivre votre parcours au sein de notre famille pour que l’on continue de créer l'extraordinaire. Écrivons le prochain chapitre de votre carrière ensemble !

Description du poste

Au sein de notre Data Office, nous recherchons notre futur Data Engineer. Vous serez responsable de la conception et de la mise en œuvre d'architectures de données robustes, tout en assurant la conformité aux réglementations et en améliorant la performance des systèmes de traitement des données. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de Data, les équipes IT et les autres départements pour comprendre les besoins en données et fournir des solutions adaptées.

Vos missions principales :

  • Vous élaborez et mettez en œuvre des architectures de données solides, incluant bases de données, entrepôts de données et systèmes de traitement des données en temps réel
  • Vous planifiez et créez des structures de bases de données relationnelles pour garantir une récupération efficace et rapide des informations
  • Vous développez des systèmes capables de traiter des flux de données en temps réel pour répondre aux besoins opérationnels immédiats et assurer une prise de décision rapide
  • Vous assurez la conformité aux réglementations sur la protection des données et améliorez la performance des systèmes de traitement des données
  • Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de Data, les équipes IT et les autres départements pour comprendre les besoins en données et fournir des solutions adaptées
  • Vous créez et mettez à jour la documentation technique, incluant guides d'utilisation et schémas techniques, pour faciliter la compréhension et la maintenance des solutions

Qualifications

  • Vous avez un diplôme de Master en informatique, en gestion des données, ou dans un domaine connexe
  • Vous justifiez de plus de 3 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Engineer
  • Vous justifiez d’une solide expérience avec les bases de données relationnelles, NoSQL, DBT, ETL (Talend ou équivalent), Python, Pyspark
  • Vous avez des compétences et connaissances avérées en conception et mise en œuvre d'architectures de données, des réglementations sur la protection des données et des meilleures pratiques en matière de sécurité des données
  • Vous possédez une expérience de développement dans le Cloud – la connaissance d’Azure Databricks est un plus
  • Vous avez des notions dans les concepts et technologies suivants : Spark, agilité, AI/GenAI

Informations supplémentaires

Ce que nous offrons :

  • La prise en charge des assurances maladie (base et complémentaire)
  • 5 semaines annuelles de vacances et 2 semaines supplémentaires entre Noël et Nouvel An grâce au cumul quotidien de minutes additionnelles
  • Une contribution à vos activités sportives ou culturelles
  • La possibilité selon la fonction de travailler à distance
  • Un restaurant d’entreprise
  • Une LPP avantageuse

Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.

Le masculin vaut pour le féminin.

4198568924,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-analyst-at-charles-levick-limited-4198568924?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=QVxk3xbpTvAwHLvzRfQEMw%3D%3D,Quantitative Analyst,Charles Levick Limited,"Geneva, Switzerland","Quantitative Analyst – Market Risk & Valuation

A leading commodities firm is looking for a skilled Quantitative Analyst to strengthen its Trading Risk & Quant Analytics Team. This role focuses on XVA pricing methodologies and supporting the development of a Quant Library, offering a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
Strong grasp of derivatives pricing and risk concepts.
Proficiency in Python programming (knowledge of C++ or other languages is beneficial).
Strong ability to collaborate across different teams and functions.
Quick adaptability to new ideas and problem-solving approaches.
Experience in delivering optimised and well-structured code.
Designing and refining quantitative models and analytical tools.
Working closely with teams across the business, including Trading, Middle Office, Risk, Credit, and Technology.
Evaluating XVA-related risks associated with new transactions.
A Master’s degree or higher in a numerical field such as Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, Science, or Finance.
A minimum of 3 years’ experience in an XVA quant role - ideally within commodities (including CVA/FVA), though experience in rates or FX will also be considered.
Proven ability to write robust, production-level code using best practices (source control, CI/CD pipelines, unit/regression testing).
Direct interaction with Trading, Risk, Credit, Middle Office, and IT teams.
Reports to the XVA Lead covering energy and commodity trading.

Quant Analytics Team. This role focuses on XVA pricing methodologies and supporting the development of a Quant Library, offering a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.

4188005376,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-market-analyst-at-holcim-schweiz-suisse-svizzera-4188005376?position=24&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=OmkkRKO5SQVZQcrcsLqZ4g%3D%3D,Business Intelligence & Market Analyst,Holcim Schweiz / Suisse / Svizzera,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Location:

Holcim Trading & Shipping (HTS) is the trading arm of Holcim Group, the world leader in the building materials industry. HTS is specialized to meet the needs of customers and suppliers around the world through a unique product and service portfolio provided from offices in Zurich, Singapore and Miami.

HTS delivers solutions for the seaborne import and export needs of cementitious materials, gypsum, solid fuels and other dry bulk goods. Teams of dedicated specialists manage a diverse network of seaborne logistics, operating bulk carrier vessels and specialized cement carriers. HTS is a leading international trader, meeting the needs of the cement/construction industry worldwide.

At Holcim, there is endless opportunity for you to play your part. Whether you’re in a technical, managerial, or frontline role, you can shape a career that works for you. With us you’ll have the chance to embrace the passion we share for our planet. You’ll be encouraged to seek out diverse perspectives, share your ideas and build the skills and connections you need to perform at your best. Because it’s only when we work together in a culture where everyone thrives, that we can build the world we all want to live in.
Join our amazing team and contribute as a:

The Market Analyst is responsible for the collection, processing, maintenance, reporting and analysis of Business Intelligence data in Holcim Trading. The position will play a key role in supporting specific growth initiatives of our company while helping us drive sustainability and innovation in construction and trading practices. This is a unique opportunity to work on exciting and new projects, develop valuable skills, and contribute to meaningful change in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
Read, screen, analyze raw data coming from various sources on a day to day basis, either quantitative data (flows statistics, customs statistics, port statistics, …) or qualitative
Conduct relevant research using various sources, from electronic database, websites, and other published sources, using sophisticated search engines, query tools, and other web
Set up/maintain/improve our commodities databases, statistics and related news
Suggest and implement new ideas to make the data management more efficient
Suggest and contribute to automations of data processing and management
Conduct in-depth market research and analysis to identify emerging trends, customer needs, and opportunities for growth. Utilize findings to develop strategies that align
Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key clients, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and retention.
Evaluate and assess potential risks associated with projects, materials, and market trends.
Develop mitigation strategies to protect the company from potential setbacks.
Lead customer-facing communication efforts, including presentations, client meetings, and social media outreach. Collaborate with internal teams to ensure
customer expectations are met and exceeded.
Promote and implement sustainable building practices and materials, ensuring alignment with the company’s overall vision of environmental responsibility and innovation.
Master’s degree in Management, Entrepreneurship, or equivalent

Ideally, 1-2 years of experience in a customer-facing role (B2B or B2C) with international exposure, business development, or sustainability-related projects (internships, part-time roles, or project work are highly valued).
A passion for sustainability, innovation, and helping businesses thrive in a rapidly changing world.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to connect with people and build meaningful relationships.
Public speaking by engaging diverse audiences at high-profile international events, showcasing the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively.
A proactive and problem-solving mindset, willing to take initiative and think creatively.
Familiarity with social media platforms (experience in content creation or digital marketing is a plus).
A fundamental knowledge of the construction industry, sustainability trends, and basic legal frameworks.
Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively in a diverse and dynamic environment.
Excellent English language and Hindi language, written and spoken
Knowledge of at least 2 more languages would be an asset: German, French, Arabic.
Did we spark your interest? Build your future with us and apply.

column4:
Market Analyst

Summary Of The Job

The Market Analyst is responsible for the collection, processing, maintenance, reporting and analysis of Business Intelligence data in Holcim Trading. The position will play a key role in supporting specific growth initiatives of our company while helping us drive sustainability and innovation in construction and trading practices. This is a unique opportunity to work on exciting and new projects, develop valuable skills, and contribute to meaningful change in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.

Main Activities / Responsibilities

Data Management:

  • Read, screen, analyze raw data coming from various sources on a day to day basis, either quantitative data (flows statistics, customs statistics, port statistics, …) or qualitative
  • Conduct relevant research using various sources, from electronic database, websites, and other published sources, using sophisticated search engines, query tools, and other web


technologies

  • Set up/maintain/improve our commodities databases, statistics and related news
  • Suggest and implement new ideas to make the data management more efficient
  • Suggest and contribute to automations of data processing and management


Market Analysis &
column5:
Strategy:

  • Conduct in-depth market research and analysis to identify emerging trends, customer needs, and opportunities for growth. Utilize findings to develop strategies that align


with the company’s sustainability goals.

Customer Relationship Management:

  • Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key clients, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and retention.


Risk Management:

  • Evaluate and assess potential risks associated with projects, materials, and market trends.
  • Develop mitigation strategies to protect the company from potential setbacks.


Communication &
column6:
Coordination:

  • Lead customer-facing communication efforts, including presentations, client meetings, and social media outreach. Collaborate with internal teams to ensure


customer expectations are met and exceeded.

Sustainability Integration:

  • Promote and implement sustainable building practices and materials, ensuring alignment with the company’s overall vision of environmental responsibility and innovation.


Profile Required

Education/ Qualification:

Master’s degree in Management, Entrepreneurship, or equivalent

Experience:

Ideally, 1-2 years of experience in a customer-facing role (B2B or B2C) with international exposure, business development, or sustainability-related projects (internships, part-time roles, or project work are highly valued).

A passion for sustainability, innovation, and helping businesses thrive in a rapidly changing world.

Knowledge and skills:

  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to connect with people and build meaningful relationships.
  • Public speaking by engaging diverse audiences at high-profile international events, showcasing the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively.
  • A proactive and problem-solving mindset, willing to take initiative and think creatively.
  • Familiarity with social media platforms (experience in content creation or digital marketing is a plus).
  • A fundamental knowledge of the construction industry, sustainability trends, and basic legal frameworks.
  • Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively in a diverse and dynamic environment.


Languages:

Excellent English language and Hindi language, written and spoken

Knowledge of at least 2 more languages would be an asset: German, French, Arabic.

This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

In dieser verantwortungsvollen Position berichten Sie direkt an den Head of Sales und agieren als Business Partner für unser Vertriebsteam im Bereich Animal Health. Sie leisten einen wesentlichen Beitrag zur Optimierung unserer Datenqualität, CRM-Systeme und Vertriebsstrategie. Mit fundierten Analysen und systematischer Unterstützung fördern Sie die operative und kommerzielle Exzellenz. Sie sind ein proaktiver Teamplayer, der sich durch eine zielorientierte Arbeitsweise und die Fähigkeit auszeichnet, über Abteilungsgrenzen hinweg zu kollaborieren und gemeinsam Erfolge zu erzielen.
Verantwortung für die Verwaltung und Optimierung von Veeva CRM und Veeva Align sowie Gewährleistung einer nahtlosen Integration, Datenintegrität und Compliance
Überwachung der Datenqualität sowie Sicherstellung der Einhaltung von Datenschutz- und Zustimmungsvorgaben
Unterstützung des Vertriebsteams durch Datenpflege im Veeva CRM-System und Zusammenarbeit mit dem externen Data Steward
Nachverfolgung von digitalen und Promotion-Aktivitäten sowie Verfolgung von Werbematerialien und Sicherstellung der Einhaltung von Branchenstandards
Erstellung von Analysen zur Vertriebsleistung und Unterstützung bei KPI-Entwicklung und Reporting mit Power BI
Entwicklung von Schulungsunterlagen, Unterstützung bei Onboarding und aktive Beteiligung an cross-funktionalen Projekten
Abgeschlossenes oder laufendes Studium in IT, Data Science, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Erfahrung mit CRM-Systemen, idealerweise Veeva, sowie fundierte Kenntnisse in Excel (inkl. Pivot-Tabellen, Power Query)
Analytisches Denkvermögen und Erfahrung mit Power BI oder ähnlichen Visualisierungstools
Ausgeprägte Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit sowie Präsentationssicherheit
Selbstbewusstes, proaktives Auftreten und Erfahrung in lateraler Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern

column1: With us, you can develop your own path in a company with a culture that knows our differences are our strengths \u2013 and break new ground in the drive to make millions of lives better.

Here, your development is our priority. Supporting you to build a career as part of a workplace that is independent, authentic and bold, while tackling challenging work in a respectful and friendly environment where everyone is valued and welcomed.

Alongside, you have access to programs and groups that ensure your health and wellbeing are looked after \u2013 as we make major investments to drive global accessibility to healthcare. By being part of a team that is constantly innovating, you'll be helping to transform lives for generations.

  • Verantwortung für die Verwaltung und Optimierung von Veeva CRM und Veeva Align sowie Gewährleistung einer nahtlosen Integration, Datenintegrität und Compliance
  • Überwachung der Datenqualität sowie Sicherstellung der Einhaltung von Datenschutz- und Zustimmungsvorgaben
  • Unterstützung des Vertriebsteams durch Datenpflege im Veeva CRM-System und Zusammenarbeit mit dem externen Data Steward
  • Nachverfolgung von digitalen und Promotion-Aktivitäten sowie Verfolgung von Werbematerialien und Sicherstellung der Einhaltung von Branchenstandards
  • Erstellung von Analysen zur Vertriebsleistung und Unterstützung bei KPI-Entwicklung und Reporting mit Power BI
  • Entwicklung von Schulungsunterlagen, Unterstützung bei Onboarding und aktive Beteiligung an cross-funktionalen Projekten


Das bringen Sie mit

  • Abgeschlossenes oder laufendes Studium in IT, Data Science, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einem verwandten Bereich
  • Erfahrung mit CRM-Systemen, idealerweise Veeva, sowie fundierte Kenntnisse in Excel (inkl. Pivot-Tabellen, Power Query)
  • Analytisches Denkvermögen und Erfahrung mit Power BI oder ähnlichen Visualisierungstools
  • Ausgeprägte Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit sowie Präsentationssicherheit
  • Selbstbewusstes, proaktives Auftreten und Erfahrung in lateraler Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
column3:
Französischkenntnisse sind von Vorteil


Our Company

Why Boehringer Ingelheim?

With us, you can develop your own path in a company with a culture that knows our differences are our strengths \u2013 and break new ground in the drive to make millions of lives better.

Here, your development is our priority. Supporting you to build a career as part of a workplace that is independent, authentic and bold, while tackling challenging work in a respectful and friendly environment where everyone is valued and welcomed.

Alongside, you have access to programs and groups that ensure your health and wellbeing are looked after \u2013 as we make major investments to drive global accessibility to healthcare. By being part of a team that is constantly innovating, you'll be helping to transform lives for generations.

Want to learn more? Visit https://www.boehringer-ingelheim.com

4195940984,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4195940984?position=35&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=NGJJE3XO24WSJZ9pveH32g%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Schwyz, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4190950277,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-business-analyst-private-assets-data-solutions-at-ampstek-4190950277?position=40&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=Ztp%2FNGYLwLbF9zFi6Q74wQ%3D%3D,Data Business Analyst - Private Assets (Data Solutions),Ampstek,"Geneva, Switzerland","Job Description:
We want candidate who holds recent experience as well as who is more inclined on Advisory BA (order management) not IT BA.

To act as a talented Business Analyst in our team dedicated to the business line Alternative Advisors, for which we develop and maintain custom-made applications and integrate COTS packages. Today, our applications run on premises, but we have started our journey to the public cloud. In that future environment, we are building new data pipelines using modern cloud-native technologies and leverage SaaS business solutions.
Mandatory practical experience in Finance, and Private Assets as business analyst, business engineer
Previous experience with eFront and underlying data
Advanced capabilities in SQL, XLS (DBT and Python are a plus)
Collaborative mindset - Have proven experience where his/her capacity to foster collaboration has made a strong difference
Relevant practical experience working with agile framework
Experience of SaaS business solution integration is a plus, in particular in Alternative Investment
Passion for continuous improvements. Not satisfied with the status quo and always thinking of ways to improve
An intuitive eye for customer needs beyond the obvious
Resistance to pressure and changing environment
Functional and technical support of agile Data projects in the financial sector/banking environment throughout the entire life cycle
Specifying requirements as a business analyst using requirements engineering & modelling techniques, business cases
Developing solutions with internal and external stakeholders
Actively contribute to internal topics and implement your own ideas - thereby driving your own professional, methodological, and personal development and that of your environment
Establishing data quality assessment rules aligned with business lines to assist data engineers in automating calculations and report generation.

Job Description:

Data Business Analyst (Private Assets)

We want candidate who holds recent experience as well as who is more inclined on Advisory BA (order management) not IT BA.

To act as a talented Business Analyst in our team dedicated to the business line Alternative Advisors, for which we develop and maintain custom-made applications and integrate COTS packages. Today, our applications run on premises, but we have started our journey to the public cloud. In that future environment, we are building new data pipelines using modern cloud-native technologies and leverage SaaS business solutions.

Skills/Experience Required:

  • Mandatory practical experience in Finance, and Private Assets as business analyst, business engineer
  • Previous experience with eFront and underlying data
  • Advanced capabilities in SQL, XLS (DBT and Python are a plus)
  • Collaborative mindset - Have proven experience where his/her capacity to foster collaboration has made a strong difference
  • Relevant practical experience working with agile framework
  • Experience of SaaS business solution integration is a plus, in particular in Alternative Investment
  • Rigorous and analytical mindset
  • Passion for continuous improvements. Not satisfied with the status quo and always thinking of ways to improve
  • An intuitive eye for customer needs beyond the obvious
  • Excellent attention to details
  • Very good communicator
  • Resistance to pressure and changing environment
  • Fluent in French and English

Responsibilities:

  • Functional and technical support of agile Data projects in the financial sector/banking environment throughout the entire life cycle
  • Specifying requirements as a business analyst using requirements engineering &
column2:
modelling techniques, business cases
  • Developing solutions with internal and external stakeholders
  • Actively contribute to internal topics and implement your own ideas - thereby driving your own professional, methodological, and personal development and that of your environment
  • Establishing data quality assessment rules aligned with business lines to assist data engineers in automating calculations and report generation.

4203244069,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-m-w-d-80-100%25-at-serv-swiss-export-risk-insurance-4203244069?position=46&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=DWcm8173598mF9IoCpbUQA%3D%3D,"Data Analyst (m/w/d, 80 - 100%)",SERV Swiss Export Risk Insurance,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Die Schweizerische Exportrisikoversicherung SERV ist eine öffentlich-rechtliche Organisation des Bundes. Sie versichert Exportgeschäfte von Schweizer Unternehmen gegen politische und wirtschaftliche Risiken und stellt so den Zahlungseingang sicher. Auf diese Weise leistet die SERV einen Beitrag zur Schaffung und Erhaltung von Arbeitsplätzen und der Förderung des Wirtschaftsstandortes Schweiz.

Wir suchen an unserem Standort in Zürich eine/n motivierte/n Data Analyst (m/w/d), der sich in der Welt der Datenanalyse weiterentwickeln möchte. In dieser Position wist du Teil eines zweier Teams und unterstützt bei der Verarbeitung und Analyse von vielfältigen Datenquellen.
Zusammenführen von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Datenbeständen aus unterschiedlichen Formaten und Datenquellen
Aufbereiten der zusammengeführten Daten für die Auswertung in Analyse-Werkzeugen
Erstellung von aussagekräftigen Reports zu durchgeführten Datenanalysen, um relevante Erkenntnisse zu kommunizieren
Integration automatisierter Datenanalysen in bestehende Prozesse, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu fördern
Beratung bei der Durchführung von Auswertungen sowie Unterstützung bei der kontinuierlichen Optimierung und Dokumentation von Datenanalysen und -Werkzeugen
Abgeschlossenes Bachelor- oder Master-Studium in Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik oder einem vergleichbaren Bereich
Du bringst erste Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse und Interesse an modernen Analyse-Werkzeugen und Datenvisualisierung mit
Zudem hast du Erfahrung mit SQL und MS-SQL Datenbanken, Kenntnisse in Python oder R sind von Vorteil
Teamgeist, Kommunikationsfähigkeit und eine proaktive Arbeitsweise sowie sehr gute Kenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch (in Wort und Schrift)
Lernbereitschaft und die Motivation, sich im Bereich Datenanalyse weiterzuentwickeln
Die Möglichkeit, eigene Ideen aktiv einzubringen, die SERV mitzugestalten und Verantwortung zu übernehmen
Ein Auftrag, der Sinn macht: Wir schaffen und erhalten Arbeitsplätze in der Schweiz und fördern die Schweizer Exportwirtschaft im internationalen Wettbewerb
Vielseitige und interessante Tätigkeit in einem kollegialen und hochspezialisierten Unternehmen mit Open-Door-Mentalität
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell und zentrales, modernes Büro direkt in der Stadt Zürich
Unterstützung von Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie und weitere attraktive Anstellungsbedingungen

Dann freuen wir uns auf deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen. Fragen zur Stelle beantwortet dir gerne Herr Sascha Kaufmann, Data Scientist, T +41 58 551 55 85 Frau Miriam Wunderli, Human Resources Manager, T +41 58 551 55 86.

Die Schweizerische Exportrisikoversicherung SERV ist eine öffentlich-rechtliche Organisation des Bundes. Sie versichert Exportgeschäfte von Schweizer Unternehmen gegen politische und wirtschaftliche Risiken und stellt so den Zahlungseingang sicher. Auf diese Weise leistet die SERV einen Beitrag zur Schaffung und Erhaltung von Arbeitsplätzen und der Förderung des Wirtschaftsstandortes Schweiz.


Wir suchen an unserem Standort in Zürich eine/n motivierte/n Data Analyst (m/w/d), der sich in der Welt der Datenanalyse weiterentwickeln möchte. In dieser Position wist du Teil eines zweier Teams und unterstützt bei der Verarbeitung und Analyse von vielfältigen Datenquellen.


Deine Aufgaben

  • Zusammenführen von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Datenbeständen aus unterschiedlichen Formaten und Datenquellen
  • Aufbereiten der zusammengeführten Daten für die Auswertung in Analyse-Werkzeugen
  • Erstellung von aussagekräftigen Reports zu durchgeführten Datenanalysen, um relevante Erkenntnisse zu kommunizieren
  • Integration automatisierter Datenanalysen in bestehende Prozesse, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu fördern
  • Beratung bei der Durchführung von Auswertungen sowie Unterstützung bei der kontinuierlichen Optimierung und Dokumentation von Datenanalysen und -Werkzeugen


Dein Profil

  • Abgeschlossenes Bachelor- oder Master-Studium in Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik oder einem vergleichbaren Bereich
  • Du bringst erste Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse und Interesse an modernen Analyse-Werkzeugen und Datenvisualisierung mit
  • Zudem hast du Erfahrung mit SQL und MS-SQL Datenbanken, Kenntnisse in Python oder R sind von Vorteil
  • Teamgeist, Kommunikationsfähigkeit und eine proaktive Arbeitsweise sowie sehr gute Kenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch (in Wort und Schrift)
  • Lernbereitschaft und die Motivation, sich im Bereich Datenanalyse weiterzuentwickeln


Was wir dir bieten

  • Die Möglichkeit, eigene Ideen aktiv einzubringen, die SERV mitzugestalten und Verantwortung zu übernehmen
  • Ein Auftrag, der Sinn macht: Wir schaffen und erhalten Arbeitsplätze in der Schweiz und fördern die Schweizer Exportwirtschaft im internationalen Wettbewerb
  • Vielseitige und interessante Tätigkeit in einem kollegialen und hochspezialisierten Unternehmen mit Open-Door-Mentalität
  • Hybrides Arbeitsmodell und zentrales, modernes Büro direkt in der Stadt Zürich
  • Individuelle und zielgerichtete Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
  • Unterstützung von Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie und weitere attraktive Anstellungsbedingungen


Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann freuen wir uns auf deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen. Fragen zur Stelle beantwortet dir gerne Herr Sascha Kaufmann, Data Scientist, T +41 58 551 55 85 Frau Miriam Wunderli, Human Resources Manager, T +41 58 551 55 86.

4195949005,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4195949005?position=47&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=rlezAi1yb7amBhTsGzbB6Q%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Appenzell Inner-Rhoden, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4203172835,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-internship-12-months-at-kanadevia-inova-4203172835?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=keYI1qBY8nhTctu%2BSXv0pw%3D%3D&trackingId=ZxvWOUEPCz8afyc13ZFoyQ%3D%3D,Data Science Internship (12 months),Kanadevia Inova,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Company Description
Welcome to Kanadevia Inova, a global innovation leader in the waste infrastructure space, where we believe in creating a sustainable future through technology and innovation.
At Kanadevia Inova, we pride ourselves on being at the forefront of waste-to-X technology. We are not just waste managers
column2: we are creators of value from what communities discard. Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

column1: The Advanced Digitalization, of the Technology and Digitalization department, is developing innovative digital products to support our customers maximizing the performance of their plants. In this role you will be supporting R&D projects, under the supervision of Data Scientists, on the following tasks:
Support the specification of technical requirements, technical design of ML based products.
Conduct data exploration studies to develop concepts and validate ideas and hypotheses.
Contribute to the development of machine learning models.
Develop and maintain data labelling and annotation processes.
Develop and maintain product performance monitoring reports, focusing on machine learning performance metrics.
Contribute to the monitoring and maintenance of Azure cloud resources (e.g. Azure ML Studio).
Currently enrolled or completed BSc or MSc degree in a STEM degree (e.g. Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Mechanical or Electronic Engineering)
Exposure to python from studies, internships, or any other practical experience
Good command of English both written and verbal
Self-motivation and disciplined work ethics with a strong interest in self-learning
Responsible challenge with diversified field of activity
Team-oriented working atmosphere in an international Company
Personal development opportunities through own Inova Academy
Opportunity to gain an insight into various technical disciplines
Attractive working place (central, good transport links)
For HR agencies: Please note that we do not accept applications coming from agencies. Thank you.

Company Description

Welcome to Kanadevia Inova, a global innovation leader in the waste infrastructure space, where we believe in creating a sustainable future through technology and innovation.

Transforming Waste into Value

At Kanadevia Inova, we pride ourselves on being at the forefront of waste-to-X technology. We are not just waste managers
column2:
we are creators of value from what communities discard. Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

Job Description

The Advanced Digitalization, of the Technology and Digitalization department, is developing innovative digital products to support our customers maximizing the performance of their plants. In this role you will be supporting R&
column3:
D projects, under the supervision of Data Scientists, on the following tasks:

  • Support the specification of technical requirements, technical design of ML based products.
  • Conduct data exploration studies to develop concepts and validate ideas and hypotheses.
  • Contribute to the development of machine learning models.
  • Develop and maintain data labelling and annotation processes.
  • Develop and maintain product performance monitoring reports, focusing on machine learning performance metrics.
  • Contribute to the monitoring and maintenance of Azure cloud resources (e.g. Azure ML Studio).

Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled or completed BSc or MSc degree in a STEM degree (e.g. Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Mechanical or Electronic Engineering)
  • Exposure to python from studies, internships, or any other practical experience
  • Good command of English both written and verbal
  • Self-motivation and disciplined work ethics with a strong interest in self-learning

Additional Information

We offer

  • Responsible challenge with diversified field of activity
  • Team-oriented working atmosphere in an international Company
  • Personal development opportunities through own Inova Academy
  • Opportunity to gain an insight into various technical disciplines
  • Excellent employment conditions
  • Attractive working place (central, good transport links)
  • Modern infrastructure

For HR agencies: Please note that we do not accept applications coming from agencies. Thank you.
